Text

﻿The Years

1880

It was an uncertain spring . The weather , perpetually changing , sent clouds of blue and of purple flying over [the land]500-the land . In [the country]501-the country farmers , looking at [the fields]502-the fields , were apprehensive ; in [London]1-london umbrellas were opened and then shut by [people]503-people looking up at the sky . But in April such weather was to be expected . [Thousands of shop assistants]504-thousands of shop assistants made that remark , as [they]504-thousands of shop assistants handed neat parcels to [ladies in flounced dresses standing on the other side of the counter]505-ladies in flounced dresses standing on the other side of the counter at [Whiteley 's]2-whiteley 's and [the Army and Navy Stores]3-the army and navy stores . [Interminable processions of [shoppers]507-shoppers in [the West end]508-the west end , of [business men in [the East]4-the east]509-business men in the east]506-interminable processions of shoppers in the west end , of business men in the east , paraded [the pavements]510-the pavements , like caravans perpetually marching , - so it seemed to [those who had any reason to pause , say , to post a letter]511-those who had any reason to pause , say , to post a letter , or at a club window in [Piccadilly]5-piccadilly . The stream of landaus , victorias and hansom cabs was incessant ; for the season was beginning . In [the quieter streets]512-the quieter streets [musicians]513-musicians doled out [their]513-musicians frail and for the most part melancholy pipe of sound , which was echoed , or parodied , here in [the trees of [Hyde Park]6-hyde park]514-the trees of hyde park , here in [St. James]7-st. james 's by the twitter of sparrows and the sudden outbursts of the amorous but intermittent thrush . The pigeons in [the squares]515-the squares shuffled in the tree tops , letting fall a twig or two , and crooned over and over again the lullaby that was always interrupted . The gates at [the Marble Arch]8-the marble arch and [Apsley House]9-apsley house were blocked in the afternoon by ladies in many - coloured dresses wearing bustles , and by [gentlemen in frock coats carrying canes , wearing carnations]516-gentlemen in frock coats carrying canes , wearing carnations . Here came [the Princess]517-the princess , and as [she]517-the princess passed hats were lifted . In the basements of [the long avenues of [the residential quarters]519-the residential quarters]518-the long avenues of the residential quarters [servant girls in cap and apron]520-servant girls in cap and apron prepared tea . Deviously ascending from [the basement]521-the basement the silver teapot was placed on the table , and [virgins]522-virgins and spinsters with hands that had staunched the sores of [Bermondsey]10-bermondsey and [Hoxton]190-hoxton carefully measured out one , two , three , four spoonfuls of tea . When the sun went down a million little gaslights , shaped like the eyes in peacocks ' feathers , opened in their glass cages , but nevertheless broad stretches of darkness were left on the pavement . The mixed light of the lamps and the setting sun was reflected equally in the placid waters of [the Round Pond]11-the round pond and [the Serpentine]12-the serpentine . [Diners]523-diners - out , trotting over [the Bridge in [hansom cabs]525-hansom cabs]524-the bridge in hansom cabs , looked for a moment at [the charming vista]526-the charming vista . At length the moon rose and its polished coin , though obscured now and then by wisps of cloud , shone out with serenity , with severity , or perhaps with complete indifference . Slowly wheeling , like the rays of a searchlight , the days , the weeks , the years passed one after another across the sky .

[Colonel Abel Pargiter]191-abel was sitting after luncheon in [[his]191-abel club]527-his club talking . Since [[his]191-abel companions]528-his companions in the leather armchairs were [men of [his]191-abel own type]529-men of his own type , men who had been [soldiers]530-soldiers , [civil servants]531-civil servants , [men who had now retired]532-men who had now retired , [they]529-men of his own type were reviving with old jokes and stories now [their]529-men of his own type past in [India]13-india , [Africa]14-africa , [Egypt]15-egypt , and then , by a natural transition , [they]529-men of his own type turned to the present . It was a question of some appointment , of some possible appointment .

Suddenly [the youngest and the sprucest of the three]533-the youngest and the sprucest of the three leant forward . Yesterday [he]191-abel had lunched with . . . Here the voice of [the speaker]534-the speaker fell . [The others]535-the others bent towards [him]191-abel ; with a brief wave of [his]191-abel hand [Colonel Abel]191-abel dismissed [the servant who was removing the coffee cups]536-the servant who was removing the coffee cups . [The three baldish and greyish heads]537-the three baldish and greyish heads remained close together for a few minutes . Then [Colonel Abel]191-abel threw [himself]191-abel back in [his]191-abel chair . The curious gleam which had come into all [their]535-the others eyes when [Major Elkin]192-major elkin began [his]192-major elkin story had faded completely from [Colonel Pargiter]191-abel 's face . [He]191-abel sat staring ahead of [him]191-abel with bright blue eyes that seemed a little screwed up , as if the glare of [the East]4-the east were still in them ; and puckered at the corners as if the dust were still in them . Some thought had struck [him]191-abel that made what [the others]535-the others were saying of no interest to [him]191-abel ; indeed , it was disagreeable to [him]191-abel . [He]191-abel rose and looked out of the window down into [Piccadilly]5-piccadilly . Holding [his]191-abel cigar suspended [he]191-abel looked down on the tops of [omnibuses]539-omnibuses , [hansom cabs]525-hansom cabs , victorias , [vans and landaus]541-vans and landaus . [He]191-abel was out of it all , [his]191-abel attitude seemed to say ; [he]191-abel had no longer any finger in that pie . Gloom settled on [his]191-abel red handsome face as [he]191-abel stood gazing . Suddenly a thought struck [him]191-abel . [He]191-abel had a question to ask ; [he]191-abel turned to ask it ; but [[his]191-abel friends]542-his friends were gone . [The little group]543-the little group had broken up . [Elkins]193-elkins was already hurrying through the door ; [Brand]194-brand had moved off to talk to [another man]544-another man . [Colonel Pargiter]191-abel shut [his]191-abel mouth on the thing [he]191-abel might have said , and turned back again to the window overlooking [Piccadilly]5-piccadilly . [Everybody in [the crowded street]546-the crowded street]545-everybody in the crowded street , it seemed , had some end in view . [Everybody]547-everybody was hurrying along to keep some appointment . Even [the ladies in [their]548-the ladies in their victorias and broughams victorias and broughams]548-the ladies in their victorias and broughams were trotting down [Piccadilly]5-piccadilly on some errand or other . [People]503-people were coming back to [London]1-london ; [they]503-people were settling in for the season . But for [him]191-abel there would be no season ; for [him]191-abel there was nothing to do . [[His]191-abel wife]550-his wife was dying ; but [she]550-his wife did not die . [She]550-his wife was better today ; would be worse tomorrow ; [a new nurse]551-a new nurse was coming ; and so it went on . [He]191-abel picked up a paper and turned over the pages . [He]191-abel looked at a picture of the west front of [Cologne Cathedral]17-cologne cathedral . [He]191-abel tossed the paper back into its place among the other papers . One of these days - that was [his]191-abel euphemism for the time when [[his]191-abel wife]550-his wife was dead - [he]191-abel would give up [London]1-london , [he]191-abel thought , and live in [the country]501-the country . But then there was [the house]554-the house ; then there were [the children]555-the children ; and there was also . . . [his]191-abel face changed ; it became less discontented ; but also a little furtive and uneasy .

[He]191-abel had somewhere to go , after all . While [they]556-they were gossiping [he]191-abel had kept that thought at the back of [his]191-abel mind . When [he]191-abel turned round and found [them]556-they gone , that was the balm [he]191-abel clapped on [his]191-abel wound . [He]191-abel would go and see [Mira]195-mira ; [Mira]195-mira at least would be glad to see [him]191-abel . Thus when [he]191-abel left [the club]557-the club [he]191-abel turned not East , where [the busy men]558-the busy men were going ; nor West where [[his]191-abel own house in [Abercorn Terrace]18-abercorn terrace was]559-his own house in abercorn terrace was ; but took [his]191-abel way along [the hard paths]560-the hard paths through [the Green Park]561-the green park towards [Westminster]19-westminster . The grass was very green ; the leaves were beginning to shoot ; little green claws , like birds ' claws , were pushing out from the branches ; there was a sparkle , an animation everywhere ; the air smelt clean and brisk . But [Colonel Pargiter]191-abel saw neither the grass nor the trees . [He]191-abel marched through [the Park]562-the park , in [his]191-abel closely buttoned coat , looking straight ahead of [him]191-abel . But when [he]191-abel came to [Westminster]19-westminster [he]191-abel stopped . [He]191-abel did not like this part of the business at all . Every time [he]191-abel approached [the little street that lay under the huge bulk of [the Abbey]564-the abbey]563-the little street that lay under the huge bulk of the abbey , [the street of [dingy little houses]566-dingy little houses , with yellow curtains and cards in the window]565-the street of dingy little houses , with yellow curtains and cards in the window , [the street where [the muffin man]568-the muffin man seemed always to be ringing [his]568-the muffin man bell , where [children]569-children screamed and hopped in and out of white chalk - marks on [the pavement]570-the pavement]567-the street where the muffin man seemed always to be ringing his bell , where children screamed and hopped in and out of white chalk - marks on the pavement , [he]191-abel paused , looked to the right , looked to the left ; and then walked very sharply to [Number Thirty]20-number thirty and rang the bell . [He]191-abel gazed straight at the door as [he]191-abel waited with [his]191-abel head rather sunk . [He]191-abel did not wish to be seen standing on that door- step . [He]191-abel did not like waiting to be let in . [He]191-abel did not like it when [Mrs Sims]196-mrs sims let [him]191-abel in . There was always a smell in [the house]554-the house ; there were always dirty clothes hanging on a line in [the back garden]572-the back garden . [He]191-abel went up [the stairs]573-the stairs , sulkily and heavily , and entered [the sitting - room]574-the sitting - room .

[Nobody]575-nobody was [there]576-there ; [he]191-abel was too early . [He]191-abel looked round [the room]577-the room with distaste . There were too many little objects about . [He]191-abel felt out of place , and altogether too large as [he]191-abel stood upright before the draped fireplace in front of a screen upon which was painted [a kingfisher in the act of alighting on some bulrushes]578-a kingfisher in the act of alighting on some bulrushes . [Footsteps]197-footsteps scurried about hither and thither on the floor above . Was there [somebody]579-somebody with [her]196-mrs sims ? [he]191-abel asked [himself]191-abel listening . [Children]569-children screamed in [the street outside]581-the street outside . It was sordid ; it was mean ; it was furtive . One of these days , [he]191-abel said to [himself]191-abel . . . but the door opened and [[his]191-abel mistress]582-his mistress , [Mira]195-mira , came in .

" [Oh Bogy]198-bogy , dear ! "[195-mira] [she]195-mira exclaimed . [Her]195-mira hair was very untidy ; [she]195-mira was a little fluffy - looking ; but [she]195-mira was very much younger than [he]191-abel was and really glad to see [him]191-abel , [he]191-abel thought . The little dog bounced up at [her]195-mira .

" [Lulu]199-louisa , [Lulu]199-louisa , "[195-mira] [she]195-mira cried , catching the little dog in one hand while [she]195-mira put the other to [her]195-mira hair , " come and let [Uncle Bogy]198-bogy look at [you]199-louisa . "[195-mira]

[The Colonel]583-the colonel settled [himself]583-the colonel in the creaking basket - chair . [She]195-mira put the dog on [his]583-the colonel knee . There was a red patch - possibly eczema - behind one of its ears . [The Colonel]191-abel put on [his]583-the colonel glasses and bent down to look at the dog 's ear . [Mira]195-mira kissed [him]583-the colonel where [his]583-the colonel collar met [his]583-the colonel neck . Then [his]583-the colonel glasses fell off . [She]195-mira snatched them and put them on the dog . [The old boy]584-the old boy was out of spirits today , [she]195-mira felt . In that mysterious world of clubs and family life of which [he]584-the old boy never spoke to [her]195-mira something was wrong . [He]584-the old boy had come before [she]195-mira had done [her]195-mira hair , which was a nuisance . But [her]195-mira duty was to distract [him]584-the old boy . So [she]195-mira flitted - [her]195-mira figure , enlarging as it was , still allowed [her]195-mira to glide between table and chair - hither and thither ; removed the fire - screen and set a light , before [he]584-the old boy could stop [her]195-mira , to the grudging lodging - house fire . Then [she]195-mira perched on the arm of [his]584-the old boy chair .

" Oh , [Mira]195-mira ! "[195-mira] [she]195-mira said , glancing at [herself]195-mira in the looking - glass and shifting [her]195-mira hair - pins , " what [a dreadfully untidy girl]5143-a dreadfully untidy girl [you]195-mira are ! "[195-mira] [She]195-mira loosed a long coil and let it fall over [her]195-mira shoulders . It was beautiful gold - glancing hair still , though [she]195-mira was nearing forty and had , if the truth were known , [a daughter of eight]585-a daughter of eight boarded out with [friends]586-friends at [Bedford]21-bedford . The hair began to fall of its own accord , of its own weight , and [Bogy]198-bogy seeing it fall stooped and kissed [her]195-mira hair . A barrel - organ had begun to play down [the street]587-the street and [the children]555-the children all rushed in that direction , leaving a sudden silence . [The Colonel]583-the colonel began to stroke [her]195-mira neck . [He]583-the colonel began fumbling , with the hand that had lost two fingers , rather lower down , where the neck joins the shoulders . [Mira]195-mira slipped onto the floor and leant [her]195-mira back against [his]583-the colonel knee .

Then there was a creaking on [the stairs]573-the stairs ; [someone]591-someone tapped as if to warn [them]555-the children of [her]195-mira presence . [Mira]195-mira at once pinned [her]195-mira hair together , got up and shut the door .

[The Colonel]583-the colonel began in [his]583-the colonel methodical way to examine the dog 's ears again . Was it eczema ? or was it not eczema ? [He]583-the colonel looked at the red patch , then set the dog on its legs in the basket and waited . [He]583-the colonel did not like the prolonged whispering on [the landing outside]593-the landing outside . At length [Mira]195-mira came back ; [she]195-mira looked worried ; and when [she]195-mira looked worried [she]195-mira looked old . [She]195-mira began hunting about under cushions and covers . [She]195-mira wanted [her]195-mira bag , [she]195-mira said ; where had [she]195-mira put [her]195-mira bag ? In that litter of things , [the Colonel]583-the colonel thought , it might be anywhere . It was a lean , poverty - stricken - looking bag when [she]195-mira found it under the cushions in the corner of the sofa . [She]195-mira turned it upside down . Pocket handkerchiefs , screwed up bits of paper , silver and coppers fell out as [she]195-mira shook it . But there should have been a sovereign , [she]195-mira said . " [I]195-mira 'm sure [I]195-mira had one yesterday , "[195-mira] [she]195-mira murmured .

" How much ? "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel .

[It]596-it came to one pound - no , it came to one pound eight and sixpence , [she]195-mira said , muttering something about the washing . [The Colonel]583-the colonel slipped two sovereigns out of [his]583-the colonel little gold case and gave them to [her]195-mira . [She]195-mira took them and there was more whispering on [the landing]598-the landing .

" Washing . . . ? "[583-the colonel] thought [the Colonel]583-the colonel , looking round [the room]577-the room . [It]601-it was a dingy little hole ; but being so much older than [she]195-mira was it did not do to ask questions about the washing . Here [she]195-mira was again . [She]195-mira flitted across [the room]577-the room and sat on the floor and put [her]195-mira head against [his]583-the colonel knee . The grudging fire which had been flickering feebly had died down now . " Let it be , "[583-the colonel] [he]583-the colonel said impatiently , as [she]195-mira took up the poker . " Let it go out . "[195-mira] [She]195-mira resigned the poker . The dog snored ; the barrel organ played . [His]583-the colonel hand began its voyage up and down [her]195-mira neck , in and out of the long thick hair . In [this small room]603-this small room , so close to [the other houses]604-the other houses , dusk came quickly ; and the curtains were half drawn . [He]583-the colonel drew [her]195-mira to [him]583-the colonel ; [he]583-the colonel kissed [her]195-mira on the nape of the neck ; and then the hand that had lost two fingers began to fumble rather lower down where the neck joins the shoulders .

A sudden squall of rain struck [the pavement]570-the pavement , and [the children]555-the children , who had been skipping in and out of [[their]555-the children chalk cages]607-their chalk cages , scudded away [home]608-home . [The elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman]609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman 's cap stuck jauntily on the back of [his]609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman head , lustily chanting " Count [your]5144-your blessings , Count [your]5144-your blessings - "[609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman] turned up [his]609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman coat collar and took refuge under [the portico of [a public house]611-a public house where [he]609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman finished [his]609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman injunction]610-the portico of a public house where he finished his injunction : " Count [your]5144-your blessings . Every One . "[609-the elderly street singer , who had been swaying along the kerb , with a fisherman] Then the sun shone again ; and dried [the pavement]570-the pavement .

" It 's not boiling , "[200-milly] said [Milly Pargiter]200-milly , looking at the tea - kettle . [She]195-mira was sitting at the round table in [the front drawing - room of [the house in [Abercorn Terrace]18-abercorn terrace]614-the house in abercorn terrace]613-the front drawing - room of the house in abercorn terrace . " Not nearly boiling , "[195-mira] [she]195-mira repeated . The kettle was an old - fashioned brass kettle , chased with a design of roses that was almost obliterated . A feeble little flame flickered up and down beneath the brass bowl . [[Her]195-mira sister]615-her sister [Delia]201-delia , lying back in a chair beside [her]195-mira , watched it too . " Must a kettle boil ? "[195-mira] [she]195-mira asked idly after a moment , as if [she]195-mira expected no answer , and [Milly]200-milly did not answer . [They]616-they sat in silence watching the little flame on a tuft of yellow wick . There were many plates and cups as if [other people]617-other people were coming ; but at the moment [they]616-they were alone . [The room]577-the room was full of furniture . Opposite [them]616-they stood a Dutch cabinet with blue china on the shelves ; the sun of the April evening made a bright stain here and there on the glass . Over the fireplace the portrait of [a red - haired young woman in white muslin holding a basket of flowers on [her]195-mira lap]619-a red - haired young woman in white muslin holding a basket of flowers on her lap smiled down on [them]616-they .

[Milly]200-milly took a hairpin from [her]200-milly head and began to fray the wick into separate strands so as to increase the size of the flame .

" But that does n't do any good , "[201-delia] [Delia]201-delia said irritably as [she]201-delia watched [her]200-milly . [She]201-delia fidgeted . Everything seemed to take such an intolerable time . Then [Crosby]202-crosby came in and said , should [she]202-crosby boil the kettle in [the kitchen]620-the kitchen ? and [Milly]200-milly said No . How can [I]0-i put a stop to this fiddling and trifling , [she]0-i said to [herself]0-i , tapping a knife on the table and looking at the feeble flame that [[her]0-i sister]615-her sister was teasing with a hairpin . A gnat 's voice began to wail under the kettle ; but here the door burst open again and [a little girl in a stiff pink frock]622-a little girl in a stiff pink frock came in .

" [I]200-milly think [Nurse]203-nurse might have put [you]622-a little girl in a stiff pink frock on a clean pinafore , "[200-milly] said [Milly]200-milly severely , imitating the manner of [a grown - up person]623-a grown - up person . There was a green smudge on [her]200-milly pinafore as if [she]200-milly had been climbing trees .

" It had n't come back from the wash , "[204-rose] said [Rose]204-rose , [the little girl]624-the little girl , grumpily . [She]204-rose looked at the table , but there was no question of tea yet .

[Milly]200-milly applied [her]200-milly hairpin to the wick again . [Delia]201-delia leant back and glanced over [her]201-delia shoulder out of the window . From where [she]201-delia sat [she]201-delia could see the front door steps .

" Now , there 's [Martin]205-martin , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said gloomily . [He]205-martin had the red hair of [the woman in the picture]626-the woman in the picture , but it was rumpled .

" Go and make [yourself]205-martin tidy , "[201-delia] said [Delia]201-delia severely . " [You]205-martin 've plenty of time , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia added . " The kettle is n't boiling yet . "[201-delia]

[They]627-they all looked at the kettle . It still kept up its faint melancholy singing as the little flame flickered under the swinging bowl of brass .

" Blast that kettle , "[205-martin] said [Martin]205-martin , turning sharply away .

" [Mama]206-mama would n't like [you]205-martin to use language like that , "[205-martin] [Milly]200-milly reproved [him]205-martin as if in imitation of [an older person]628-an older person ; for [[their]627-they mother]629-their mother had been ill so long that [both sisters]630-both sisters had taken to imitating [her]629-their mother manner with [the children]555-the children . The door opened again .

" The tray , [Miss]5145-miss . . . "[202-crosby] said [Crosby]202-crosby , keeping the door open with [her]202-crosby foot . [She]202-crosby had [an invalid]632-an invalid 's tray in [her]202-crosby hands .

Here [she]201-delia applied [her]201-delia hairpin to the wick again . A thin puff of steam issued from the serpent - shaped spout . At first intermittent , it gradually became more and more powerful , until , just as [they]635-they heard steps on the stairs , one jet of powerful steam issued from the spout .

" It 's boiling ! "[200-milly] [Milly]200-milly exclaimed . " It 's boiling ! "[200-milly]

[They]635-they ate in silence . The sun , judging from the changing lights on the glass of the Dutch cabinet , seemed to be going in and out . Sometimes a bowl shone deep blue ; then became livid . Lights rested furtively upon the furniture in [the other room]636-the other room . Here was a pattern ; here was a bald patch . [Instantly Martin]205-martin wriggled out of [[his]637-he father]639-his father 's armchair ; [Delia]201-delia sat upright . " And what have [you]637-he all been up to ? "[637-he] [he]637-he asked .

[He]639-his father had lost two fingers of the right hand in the Mutiny , and the muscles had shrunk so that the right hand resembled the claw of some aged bird . [He]639-his father shuffled and fumbled ; but as [he]639-his father always ignored the injury , [[his]639-his father children]646-his children dared not help [him]639-his father . [Eleanor]276-eleanor leant back in [her]276-eleanor chair . The sun now was on the trees in [the back garden]572-the back garden . The buds were beginning to swell . The spring light of course showed up the shabbiness of the chair - covers . The large armchair had a dark stain on it where [[her]276-eleanor father]643-her father had rested [his]643-her father head , [she]276-eleanor noticed . But what a number of chairs there were - how roomy , how airy it was after [that bedroom where [old Mrs Levy]219-old mrs levy]691-that bedroom where old mrs levy - But [Milly]200-milly and [Delia]201-delia were both silent . It was the question of the dinner - party , [she]276-eleanor remembered . Which of [them]692-them was to go ? [They]692-them both wanted to go . "[503-people] [She]276-eleanor wished [they]503-people would say , " Bring [Eleanor]276-eleanor , "[503-people] or " Bring [Milly]200-milly , "[503-people] or " Bring [Delia]201-delia , "[503-people] instead of lumping [them]692-them all together . " Well , "[201-delia] said [Delia]201-delia abruptly , " [I]201-delia shall . . . "[201-delia]

[She]201-delia got up as if [she]201-delia were going somewhere . But [she]201-delia stopped . Then [she]201-delia strolled over to the window that looked out onto [the street]587-the street . [The houses opposite all]695-the houses opposite all had [the same little front gardens]696-the same little front gardens ; [the same steps]697-the same steps ; the same pillars ; the same bow windows . But now dusk was falling and they looked spectral and insubstantial in the dim light . Lamps were being lit ; a light glowed in [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room opposite ; then the curtains were drawn , and [the room]577-the room was blotted out . [Delia]201-delia stood looking down at [the street]587-the street . [A woman of the lower classes]701-a woman of the lower classes was wheeling [a perambulator]702-a perambulator ; [an old man]703-an old man tottered along with [his]703-an old man hands behind [his]703-an old man back . Then [the street]587-the street was empty ; there was a pause . Here came a hansom jingling down [the road]705-the road . [Delia]201-delia was momentarily interested . Was it going to stop at [their]706-their door or not ? [She]201-delia gazed more intently . But then , to [her]201-delia regret , [the cabman]707-the cabman jerked [his]707-the cabman reins , the horse stumbled on ; [the cab]708-the cab stopped two doors lower down .

" [Someone]591-someone 's calling on [the Stapletons]220-the stapletons , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia called back , holding apart the muslin blind . [Milly]200-milly came and stood beside [[her]200-milly sister]615-her sister , and together , through the slit , [they]706-their watched [a young man in a top- hat]710-a young man in a top- hat get out of [the cab]708-the cab . [He]710-a young man in a top- hat stretched [his]710-a young man in a top- hat hand up to pay [the driver]712-the driver .

" Do n't be caught looking , "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor warningly . [The young man]713-the young man ran up the steps into [the house]554-the house ; the door shut upon [him]713-the young man and [the cab]708-the cab drove away .

But for the moment [the two girls]716-the two girls stood at the window looking into [the street]587-the street . The crocuses were yellow and purple in [the front gardens]718-the front gardens . The almond trees and privets were tipped with green . A sudden gust of wind tore down [the street]587-the street , blowing a piece of paper along [the pavement]570-the pavement ; and a little swirl of dry dust followed after . Above the roofs was one of those red and fitful [London]1-london sunsets that make window after window burn gold . There was a wildness in the spring evening ; even here , in [Abercorn Terrace]18-abercorn terrace the light was changing from gold to black , from black to gold . Dropping the blind , [Delia]201-delia turned , and coming back into [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room , said suddenly :

" Oh my God ! "[201-delia]

[Eleanor]276-eleanor , who had taken [her]276-eleanor books again , looked up disturbed .

" Eight times eight . . . "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said aloud . " What 's eight times eight ? "[276-eleanor]

Putting [her]276-eleanor finger on the page to mark the place , [she]276-eleanor looked at [[her]276-eleanor sister]615-her sister . As [she]276-eleanor stood there with [her]276-eleanor head thrown back and [her]276-eleanor hair red in the sunset glow , [she]276-eleanor looked for a moment defiant , even beautiful . Beside [her]276-eleanor [Milly]200-milly was mouse - coloured and nondescript .

" Look here , [Delia]201-delia , "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor , shutting [her]276-eleanor book , " [you]201-delia 've only got to wait . . . "[276-eleanor] [She]276-eleanor meant but [she]276-eleanor could not say it , " until [Mama]206-mama dies . "[276-eleanor]

" No , no , no , "[201-delia] said [Delia]201-delia , stretching [her]201-delia arms out . " It 's hopeless . . . . "[201-delia] [she]201-delia began . But [she]201-delia broke off , for [Crosby]202-crosby had come in . [She]201-delia was carrying a tray . One by one with an exasperating little chink [she]201-delia put the cups , the plates , the knives , the jam - pots , the dishes of cake and the dishes of bread and butter , on the tray . Then , balancing it carefully in front of [her]201-delia , [she]201-delia went out . There was a pause . In [she]201-delia came again and folded the table - cloth and moved the tables . Again there was a pause . A moment or two later back [she]201-delia came carrying two silk - shaded lamps . [She]201-delia set one in [the front room]723-the front room , one in [the back room]724-the back room . Then [she]201-delia went , creaking in [her]201-delia cheap shoes , to the window and drew the curtains . [They]725-they slid with a familiar click along the brass rod , and soon the windows were obscured by thick sculptured folds of claret - coloured plush . When [she]201-delia had drawn the curtains in [both rooms]726-both rooms , a profound silence seemed to fall upon [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room . [The world outside]728-the world outside seemed thickly and entirely cut off . Far away down [the next street]729-the next street [they]730-they heard the voice of [a street]731-a street hawker droning ; the heavy hooves of [van horses]732-van horses clopped slowly down [the road]705-the road . For a moment wheels ground on [the road]705-the road ; then [they]725-they died out and the silence was complete .

Two yellow circles of light fell under the lamps . [Eleanor]276-eleanor drew [her]276-eleanor chair up under one of them , bent [her]276-eleanor head and went on with the part of [her]276-eleanor work that [she]276-eleanor always left to the last because [she]276-eleanor disliked it so much - adding up figures . [Her]276-eleanor lips moved and [her]276-eleanor pencil made little dots on the paper as [she]276-eleanor added eights to sixes , fives to fours .

" There ! "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said at last . " That 's done . Now [I]276-eleanor 'll go and sit with [Mama]206-mama . "[276-eleanor]

[She]276-eleanor stooped to pick up [her]276-eleanor gloves .

" No , "[200-milly] said [Milly]200-milly , throwing aside a magazine [she]200-milly had opened , " [I]200-milly 'll go . . . "[200-milly]

[Delia]201-delia suddenly emerged from [the back room in which [she]201-delia had been prowling]735-the back room in which she had been prowling .

" [I]201-delia 've nothing whatever to do , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said briefly . " [I]201-delia 'll go . "[201-delia]

[She]201-delia went [upstairs]684-upstairs , step by step , very slowly . When [she]201-delia came to [the bedroom]737-the bedroom door with the jugs and glasses on the table outside , [she]201-delia paused . The sour - sweet smell of illness slightly sickened [her]201-delia . [She]201-delia could not force [herself]201-delia to go in . Through the little window at the end of [the passage]738-the passage [she]201-delia could see flamingo - coloured curls of cloud lying on a pale - blue sky . After the dusk of [the drawing- room]739-the drawing- room , [her]201-delia eyes dazzled . [She]201-delia seemed fixed there for a moment by the light . Then on the floor above [she]201-delia heard [children]569-children 's voices - [Martin]205-martin and [Rose]204-rose quarrelling .

" Do n't then ! "[204-rose] [she]201-delia heard [Rose]204-rose say . A door slammed . [She]201-delia paused . Then [she]201-delia drew in a deep breath of air , looked once more at the fiery sky , and tapped on [the bedroom]737-the bedroom door .

[The nurse]742-the nurse rose quietly ; put [her]742-the nurse finger to [her]742-the nurse lips , and left [the room]577-the room . [Mrs Pargiter]221-mrs pargiter was asleep . Lying in a cleft of the pillows with one hand under [her]221-mrs pargiter cheek , [Mrs Pargiter]221-mrs pargiter moaned slightly as if [she]221-mrs pargiter wandered in a world where even in sleep little obstacles lay across [her]221-mrs pargiter path . [Her]221-mrs pargiter face was pouched and heavy ; the skin was stained with brown patches ; the hair which had been red was now white , save that there were queer yellow patches in it , as if some locks had been dipped in the yolk of an egg . Bare of all rings save [her]221-mrs pargiter wedding ring , [her]221-mrs pargiter fingers alone seemed to indicate that [she]221-mrs pargiter had entered the private world of illness . But [she]221-mrs pargiter did not look as if [she]221-mrs pargiter were dying ; [she]221-mrs pargiter looked as if [she]221-mrs pargiter might go on existing in this borderland between life and death for ever . [Delia]201-delia could see no change in [her]221-mrs pargiter . As [she]221-mrs pargiter sat down , everything seemed to be at full tide in [her]221-mrs pargiter . A long narrow glass by the bedside reflected a section of the sky ; it was dazzled at the moment with red light . The dressing - table was illuminated . The light struck on silver bottles and on glass bottles , all set out in the perfect order of things that are not used . At this hour of the evening [the sick- room]744-the sick- room had an unreal cleanliness , quiet and order . There by the bedside was a little table set with spectacles , prayer - book and a vase of lilies of [the valley]745-the valley . The flowers , too , looked unreal . There was nothing to do but to look .

[She]221-mrs pargiter stared at the yellow drawing of [[her]221-mrs pargiter grandfather]746-her grandfather with the high light on [his]746-her grandfather nose ; at the photograph of [[her]221-mrs pargiter Uncle]747-her uncle Horace in [his]746-her grandfather uniform ; at the lean and twisted figure on the crucifix to the right .

" But [you]685-her mother do n't believe in it ! "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter said savagely , looking at [[her]221-mrs pargiter mother]685-her mother sunk in sleep . " [You]685-her mother do n't want to die . "[221-mrs pargiter]

[She]221-mrs pargiter longed for [her]221-mrs pargiter to die . There [she]221-mrs pargiter was - soft , decayed but everlasting , lying in the cleft of the pillows , an obstacle , a prevention , an impediment to all life . [She]221-mrs pargiter tried to whip up some feeling of affection , of pity . For instance , that summer , [she]221-mrs pargiter told [herself]221-mrs pargiter , at [Sidmouth]22-sidmouth , when [she]221-mrs pargiter called [me]0-i up [the garden steps]749-the garden steps . . . . But the scene melted as [she]221-mrs pargiter tried to look at it . There was the other scene of course - [the man in the frock - coat with the flower in [his]746-her grandfather button - hole]750-the man in the frock - coat with the flower in his button - hole . But [she]221-mrs pargiter had sworn not to think of that till bedtime . What then should [she]221-mrs pargiter think of ? [Grandpapa]222-grandpapa with the white light on [his]746-her grandfather nose ? The prayer - book ? The lilies of [the valley]745-the valley ? Or the looking - glass ? The sun had gone in ; the glass was dim and reflected now only a dun - coloured patch of sky . [She]221-mrs pargiter could resist no longer .

" Wearing a white flower in [his]746-her grandfather button - hole , "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter began . It required a few minutes ' preparation . There must be [a hall]752-a hall ; [banks of palms]753-banks of palms ; a floor beneath [them]752-a hall crowded with [people]503-people 's heads . The charm was beginning to work . [She]221-mrs pargiter became permeated with delicious starts of flattering and exciting emotion . [She]221-mrs pargiter was on [the platform]755-the platform ; there was [a huge audience]756-a huge audience ; [everybody]547-everybody was shouting , waving handkerchiefs , hissing and whistling . Then [she]221-mrs pargiter stood up . [She]221-mrs pargiter rose all in white in the middle of [the platform]755-the platform ; [Mr Parnell]223-parnell was by [her]221-mrs pargiter side .

" [I]221-mrs pargiter am speaking in the cause of Liberty , "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter began , throwing out [her]221-mrs pargiter hands , " in the cause of Justice . . . . "[221-mrs pargiter] [They]759-they were standing side by side . [He]223-parnell was very pale but [his]223-parnell dark eyes glowed . [He]223-parnell turned to [her]221-mrs pargiter and whispered . . . .

There was a sudden interruption . [Mrs Pargiter]221-mrs pargiter had raised [herself]221-mrs pargiter on [her]221-mrs pargiter pillows .

" Where am [I]221-mrs pargiter ? "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter cried . [She]221-mrs pargiter was frightened and bewildered , as [she]221-mrs pargiter often was on waking . " [Here]5159-here , [Mama]206-mama ! Here ! "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter said wildly . " Here , in [[your]206-mama own room]5160-your own room . "[221-mrs pargiter]

[She]221-mrs pargiter laid [her]221-mrs pargiter hand on the counterpane . [Mrs Pargiter]221-mrs pargiter clutched it nervously . [She]221-mrs pargiter did not seem to recognise [[her]221-mrs pargiter daughter]762-her daughter .

" What 's happening ? "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter said . " Where am [I]221-mrs pargiter ? "[221-mrs pargiter] Then [she]221-mrs pargiter looked at [Delia]201-delia and remembered .

" Oh , [Delia]201-delia - [I]221-mrs pargiter was dreaming , "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter murmured half apologetically . [She]221-mrs pargiter lay for a moment looking out of the window . The lamps were being lit , and a sudden soft spurt of light came in [the street outside]581-the street outside .

" It 's been a fine day . . . "[221-mrs pargiter] [she]221-mrs pargiter hesitated , " for . . . "[221-mrs pargiter] It seemed as if [she]221-mrs pargiter could not remember what for .

" A lovely day , yes , [Mama]206-mama , "[201-delia] [Delia]201-delia repeated with mechanical cheerfulness .

" [Aunt Eugénie]225-eugénie - "[201-delia] [she]201-delia began .

" [Aunt Eugénie]225-eugénie brought [you]201-delia some flowers , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said .

" [The dear little boy]5164-the dear little boy died , but save for that . . . "[221-mrs pargiter] [She]221-mrs pargiter stopped again . [What little boy]770-what little boy had died ? [She]201-delia began counting the twists on the counterpane as [she]201-delia waited for [[her]201-delia mother]685-her mother to speak .

" [You]201-delia know all [the cousins]5165-the cousins used to come together in the summer , "[685-her mother] [[her]201-delia mother]685-her mother suddenly resumed . " There was [[your]201-delia Uncle]5161-your uncle [Horace]226-horace . . . . "[685-her mother]

" [The one with the glass eye]5167-the one with the glass eye , "[201-delia] said [Delia]201-delia .

" Yes . [He]226-horace hurt [his]226-horace eye on the rocking - horse . [The aunts]5168-the aunts thought so much of [Horace]226-horace . [They]5168-the aunts would say . . . "[685-her mother] Here there was a long pause . [She]685-her mother seemed to be fumbling to find the exact words .

" When [Horace]226-horace comes . . . remember to ask [him]226-horace about the dining - room door . "[685-her mother]

A curious amusement seemed to fill [Mrs Pargiter]221-mrs pargiter . [She]221-mrs pargiter actually laughed . [She]221-mrs pargiter must be thinking of some long - past family joke , [Delia]201-delia supposed , as [she]201-delia watched the smile flicker and fade away . There was complete silence . [[Her]201-delia mother]685-her mother lay with [her]685-her mother eyes shut ; the hand with the single ring , the white and wasted hand , lay on the counterpane . In the silence [they]774-they could hear a coal click in the grate and a street hawker droning down [the road]705-the road . [Mrs Pargiter]221-mrs pargiter said no more . [She]685-her mother lay perfectly still . Then [she]685-her mother sighed profoundly .

The door opened , and [the nurse]742-the nurse came in . [Delia]201-delia rose and went out . Where am [I]0-i ? [she]0-i asked [herself]0-i , staring at a white jug stained pink by the setting sun . For a moment [she]0-i seemed to be in some borderland between life and death . Where am [I]0-i ? [she]0-i repeated , looking at the pink jug , for it all looked strange . Then [she]0-i heard water rushing and feet thudding on the floor above .

" Here [you]0-i are , [Rosie]204-rose , "[777-nurse] said [Nurse]777-nurse , looking up from the wheel of the sewing - machine as [Rose]204-rose came in .

[The nursery]778-the nursery was brightly lit ; there was an unshaded lamp on the table . [Mrs C. , who came every week with the washing]779-mrs c. , who came every week with the washing , was sitting in the armchair with a cup in [her]779-mrs c. , who came every week with the washing hand . " Go and get [your]0-i sewing , there 's [a good girl]5169-a good girl , "[203-nurse] said [Nurse]203-nurse as [Rose]204-rose shook hands with [Mrs C.]227-mrs c. , " or [you]0-i 'll never be done in time for [Papa]207-papa 's birthday , "[203-nurse] [she]203-nurse added , clearing a space on the nursery table .

[Rose]204-rose opened the table drawer and took out the boot - bag that [she]204-rose was embroidering with a design of blue and red flowers for [[her]204-rose father]643-her father 's birthday . There were still several clusters of little pencilled roses to be worked . [She]204-rose spread it on the table and examined it as [Nurse]203-nurse resumed what [she]203-nurse was saying to [Mrs C.]227-mrs c. about [[Mrs Kirby]228-mrs kirby 's daughter]781-mrs kirby 's daughter . But [Rose]204-rose did not listen .

Then [I]0-i shall go by [myself]0-i , [she]0-i decided , straightening out the boot- bag . If [Martin]205-martin wo n't come with [me]0-i , then [I]0-i shall go by [myself]0-i .

" [I]0-i left [my]0-i work - box in [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room , "[0-i] [she]0-i said aloud .

" Well , then , go and fetch it , "[203-nurse] said [Nurse]203-nurse , but [she]203-nurse was not attending ; [she]203-nurse wanted to go on with what [she]203-nurse was saying to [Mrs C.]227-mrs c. about [[the grocer]782-the grocer 's daughter]783-the grocer 's daughter .

Now the adventure has begun , [Rose]204-rose said to [herself]204-rose as [she]204-rose stole on tiptoe to [the night nursery]784-the night nursery . Now [she]204-rose must provide [herself]204-rose with ammunition and provisions ; [she]204-rose must steal [Nurse]203-nurse 's latchkey ; but where was it ? Every night it was hidden in a new place for fear of [burglars]785-burglars . It would be either under the handkerchief - case or in the little box where [she]204-rose kept [[her]204-rose mother]685-her mother 's gold watch - chain . There it was . Now [she]204-rose had [her]204-rose pistol and [her]204-rose shot , [she]204-rose thought , taking [her]204-rose own purse from [her]204-rose own drawer , and enough provisions , [she]204-rose thought , as [she]204-rose hung [her]204-rose hat and coat over [her]204-rose arm , to last a fortnight .

[She]204-rose stole past [the nursery]778-the nursery , down the stairs . [She]204-rose listened intently as [she]204-rose passed [the schoolroom]687-the schoolroom door . [She]204-rose must be careful not to tread on a dry branch , or to let any twig crack under [her]204-rose , [she]204-rose told [herself]204-rose , as [she]204-rose went on tiptoe . Again [she]204-rose stopped and listened as [she]204-rose passed [[her]204-rose mother]685-her mother 's bedroom door . All was silent . Then [she]204-rose stood for a moment on [the landing]598-the landing , looking down into [the hall]638-the hall . The dog was asleep on the mat ; [the coast]792-the coast was clear ; [the hall]638-the hall was empty . [She]204-rose heard voices murmuring in [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room .

[She]204-rose turned the latch of the front door with extreme gentleness , and closed it with scarcely a click behind [her]204-rose . Until [she]204-rose was round the corner [she]204-rose crouched close to the wall so that [nobody]575-nobody could see [her]204-rose . When [she]204-rose reached the corner under the laburnum tree [she]204-rose stood erect .

" [I]204-rose am [Pargiter of Pargiter]229-pargiter 's Horse , "[204-rose] [she]204-rose said , flourishing [her]204-rose hand , " riding to the rescue ! "[204-rose]

[She]204-rose was riding by night on a desperate mission to [a besieged garrison]796-a besieged garrison , [she]204-rose told [herself]204-rose . [She]204-rose had a secret message - [she]204-rose clenched [her]204-rose fist on [her]204-rose purse - to deliver to [the General]797-the general in person . All [their]798-their lives depended upon it . The British flag was still flying on [the central tower]799-the central tower - [[Lamley]216-mrs lamley 's shop]800-lamley 's shop was [the central tower]799-the central tower ; [the General]797-the general was standing on the roof of [[Lamley]216-mrs lamley 's shop]800-lamley 's shop with [his]797-the general telescope to [his]797-the general eye . All [their]798-their lives depended upon [her]204-rose riding to [them]798-their through [the enemy 's country]804-the enemy 's country . Here [she]204-rose was galloping across [the desert]805-the desert . [She]204-rose began to trot . It was growing dark . The street lamps were being lit . [The lamplighter]806-the lamplighter was poking [his]806-the lamplighter stick up into the little trap- door ; the trees in [the front gardens]718-the front gardens made a wavering network of shadow on [the pavement]570-the pavement ; [the pavement]570-the pavement stretched before [her]204-rose broad and dark . Then there was the crossing ; and then there was [[Lamley]216-mrs lamley 's shop]800-lamley 's shop on [the little island of shops opposite]811-the little island of shops opposite . [She]204-rose had only to cross [the desert]805-the desert , to ford [the river]813-the river , and [she]204-rose was safe . Flourishing the arm that held the pistol , [she]204-rose clapped spurs to [her]204-rose horse and galloped down [Melrose Avenue]23-melrose avenue . As [she]204-rose ran past the pillar - box the figure of [a man]814-a man suddenly emerged under the gas lamp .

" [The enemy]5171-the enemy ! "[204-rose] [Rose]204-rose cried to [herself]204-rose . " [The enemy]5171-the enemy ! Bang ! "[204-rose] [she]204-rose cried , pulling the trigger of [her]204-rose pistol and looking [him]814-a man full in the face as [she]204-rose passed [him]814-a man . It was a horrid face : white , peeled , pock- marked ; [he]814-a man leered at [her]204-rose . [He]814-a man put out [his]814-a man arm as if to stop [her]204-rose . [He]814-a man almost caught [her]204-rose . [She]204-rose dashed past [him]814-a man . The game was over .

[She]204-rose was [herself]204-rose again , [a little girl who had disobeyed [[her]204-rose sister]615-her sister , in [her]204-rose house shoes , flying for safety to [[Lamley]216-mrs lamley 's shop]800-lamley 's shop]815-a little girl who had disobeyed her sister , in her house shoes , flying for safety to lamley 's shop .

" [Miss]5198-miss - "[202-crosby] said [Crosby]202-crosby in a whisper , opening the door behind [Eleanor]276-eleanor 's back . [She]202-crosby whispered a few words to [Eleanor]276-eleanor privately .

" Some message from [Nurse]203-nurse , "[200-milly] said [Milly]200-milly .

[The Colonel]583-the colonel , who had just helped [himself]583-the colonel to cutlets , held [his]583-the colonel knife and fork in [his]583-the colonel hand . [They]904-they all held [their]904-they knives suspended . [Nobody]575-nobody liked to go on eating .

" Well , let 's get on with [our]904-they dinner , "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel , abruptly attacking [his]583-the colonel cutlet . [He]583-the colonel had lost [his]583-the colonel geniality . [Morris]237-morris helped [himself]237-morris tentatively to potatoes . Then [Crosby]202-crosby reappeared . [She]202-crosby stood at the door , with [her]202-crosby pale - blue eyes looking very prominent .

" What is it , [Crosby]202-crosby ? What is it ? "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel .

" [The Mistress]5199-the mistress , [sir]5200-sir , taken worse , [I]202-crosby think , [sir]5200-sir , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby said with a curious whimper in [her]202-crosby voice . [Everybody]547-everybody got up .

" [You]583-the colonel wait . [I]237-morris 'll go and see , "[237-morris] said [Morris]237-morris . [They]547-everybody all followed [him]583-the colonel out into [the hall]638-the hall . [The Colonel]583-the colonel was still holding [his]583-the colonel dinner napkin . [Morris]237-morris ran [upstairs]684-upstairs ; in a moment [he]237-morris came down again .

" [Mama]206-mama 's had a fainting - fit , "[237-morris] [he]237-morris said to [the Colonel]583-the colonel . " [I]237-morris 'm going to fetch [Prentice]246-dr. prentice . "[237-morris] [He]583-the colonel snatched [his]583-the colonel hat and coat and ran down [the front steps]913-the front steps . [They]547-everybody heard [him]583-the colonel whistling for [a cab]914-a cab as [they]547-everybody stood uncertainly in [the hall]638-the hall .

" Finish [your]201-delia dinner , [girls]5202-girls , "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel peremptorily . But [he]583-the colonel paced up and down [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room , holding [his]583-the colonel dinner napkin in [his]583-the colonel hand .

" It has come , "[201-delia] [Delia]201-delia said to [herself]201-delia ; " it has come ! "[201-delia] An extraordinary feeling of relief and excitement possessed [her]201-delia . [[Her]201-delia father]643-her father was pacing from [one drawing - room]919-one drawing - room to the other ; [she]201-delia followed [him]643-her father in ; but [she]201-delia avoided [him]643-her father . [They]920-they were too much alike ; [each]921-each knew what [the other]922-the other was feeling . [She]201-delia stood at the window looking up [the street]587-the street . There had been a shower of rain . [The street]587-the street was wet ; the roofs were shining . Dark clouds were moving across the sky ; the branches were tossing up and down in the light of the street lamps . Something in [her]201-delia was tossing up and down too . [Something unknown]247-something unknown seemed to be approaching . Then a gulping sound behind [her]201-delia made [her]201-delia turn . It was [Milly]200-milly . [She]201-delia was standing by the mantelpiece under the picture of [the white - robed girl with the flower - basket]925-the white - robed girl with the flower - basket , and the tears slid slowly down [her]201-delia cheeks . [Delia]201-delia moved towards [her]201-delia ; [she]201-delia ought to go up to [her]201-delia and put [her]201-delia arms round [her]201-delia shoulders ; but [she]201-delia could not do it . Real tears were sliding down [Milly]200-milly 's cheeks . But [her]201-delia own eyes were dry . [She]201-delia turned to the window again . [The street]587-the street was empty - only the branches were tossing up and down in the lamplight . [The Colonel]583-the colonel paced up and down ; once [he]583-the colonel knocked against a table and said " Damn ! "[583-the colonel] [They]928-they heard steps moving about in [the room]577-the room [upstairs]684-upstairs . [They]928-they heard voices murmuring . [Delia]201-delia turned to the window .

[A hansom]931-a hansom came trotting down [the street]587-the street . [Morris]237-morris jumped out directly [the cab]708-the cab stopped . [Dr. Prentice]246-dr. prentice followed [him]237-morris . [He]246-dr. prentice went straight [upstairs]684-upstairs and [Morris]237-morris joined [them]928-they in [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room .

" Why not finish [your]928-they dinner ? "[583-the colonel] [the Colonel]583-the colonel said gruffly , coming to a halt and standing upright before [them]928-they .

" Oh , after [he]237-morris 's gone , "[237-morris] said [Morris]237-morris irritably .

[The Colonel]583-the colonel resumed [his]583-the colonel pacing .

Then [he]583-the colonel stopped [his]583-the colonel pacing , and stood with [his]583-the colonel hands behind [him]583-the colonel in front of the fire . [He]583-the colonel had a braced look as if [he]583-the colonel were holding [himself]583-the colonel ready for an emergency .

[We]928-they 're both acting , [Delia]201-delia thought to [herself]201-delia , stealing a glance at [him]583-the colonel , but [he]583-the colonel 's doing it better than [I]0-i am .

[She]201-delia looked out of the window again . The rain was falling . When it crossed the lamplight it glanced in long strips of silver light .

" It 's raining , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said in a low voice , but [nobody]575-nobody answered [her]201-delia .

At last [they]928-they heard footsteps on the stairs and [Dr. Prentice]246-dr. prentice came in . [He]246-dr. prentice shut the door quietly but said nothing .

" Well ? "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel , facing up to [him]246-dr. prentice .

There was a prolonged pause .

" How d'you find [her]201-delia ? "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel .

[Dr. Prentice]246-dr. prentice moved [his]246-dr. prentice shoulders slightly .

" [She]201-delia 's rallied , "[246-dr. prentice] [he]246-dr. prentice said . " For the moment , "[246-dr. prentice] [he]246-dr. prentice added .

[Delia]201-delia felt as if [his]246-dr. prentice words struck [her]201-delia violently a blow on the head . [She]201-delia sank down on the arm of a chair .

So [you]201-delia 're not going to die , [she]201-delia said , looking at [the girl balanced on the trunk of a tree]941-the girl balanced on the trunk of a tree ; [she]201-delia seemed to simper down at [[her]201-delia daughter]762-her daughter with smiling malice . [You]201-delia 're not going to die - never , never ! [she]201-delia cried clenching [her]201-delia hands together beneath [[her]201-delia mother]685-her mother 's picture .

" Now , shall [we]946-they get on with [our]946-they dinner ? "[583-the colonel] said [the Colonel]583-the colonel , taking up the napkin which [he]583-the colonel had dropped on the drawing - room table .

It was a pity - the dinner was spoilt , [Crosby]202-crosby thought , bringing up the cutlets from [the kitchen]620-the kitchen again . The meat was dried up , and the potatoes had a brown crust on top of them . One of the candles was scorching its shade too , [she]202-crosby observed as [she]202-crosby put the dish down in front of [the Colonel]191-abel . Then [she]202-crosby shut the door on [them]946-they , and [they]946-they began to eat [their]946-they dinner .

All was quiet in [the house]554-the house . The dog slept on its mat at the foot of [the stairs]573-the stairs . All was quiet outside [the sickroom]949-the sickroom door . A faint sound of snoring came from [the bedroom where [Martin]205-martin lay asleep]950-the bedroom where martin lay asleep . In [the day nursery]951-the day nursery [Mrs C.]227-mrs c. and [the nurse]742-the nurse had resumed [their]946-they supper , which [they]946-they had interrupted when [they]946-they heard sounds in [the hall below]953-the hall below . [Rose]204-rose lay asleep in [the night nursery]784-the night nursery . For some time [she]204-rose slept profoundly , curled round with the blankets tight twisted over [her]204-rose head . Then [she]204-rose stirred and stretched [her]204-rose arms out . Something had swum up on top of the blackness . An oval white shape hung in front of [her]204-rose dangling , as if it hung from a string . [She]204-rose half opened [her]204-rose eyes and looked at it . It bubbled with grey spots that went in and out . [She]204-rose woke completely . A face was hanging close to [her]204-rose as if it dangled on a bit of string . [She]204-rose shut [her]204-rose eyes ; but the face was still there , bubbling in and out , grey , white , purplish and pock - marked . [She]204-rose put out [her]204-rose hand to touch the big bed next [hers]204-rose . But [it]955-it was empty . [She]204-rose listened . [She]204-rose heard the clatter of knives and the chatter of voices in [the day nursery]951-the day nursery across [the passage]738-the passage . But [she]204-rose could not sleep .

[She]204-rose made [herself]204-rose think of a flock of sheep penned up in a hurdle in [a field]958-a field . [She]204-rose made one of [the sheep]959-the sheep jump the hurdle ; then another . [She]204-rose counted [them]959-the sheep as [they]959-the sheep jumped . One , two , three , four - [they]959-the sheep jumped over the hurdle . But the fifth sheep would not jump . [It]960-it turned round and looked at [her]204-rose . [Its]960-it long narrow face was grey ; its lips moved ; it was the face of [the man at the pillar - box]961-the man at the pillar - box , and [she]204-rose was alone with [it]960-it . If [she]204-rose shut [her]204-rose eyes there it was ; if [she]204-rose opened them , there it was still .

[She]204-rose sat up in bed and cried out , " [Nurse]777-nurse ! [Nurse]777-nurse ! "[204-rose]

There was dead silence everywhere . The clatter of knives and forks in [the next room]962-the next room had ceased . [She]204-rose was alone with something horrible . Then [she]204-rose heard a shuffling in [the passage]738-the passage . It came closer and closer . It was [the man]826-the man [himself]826-the man . [His]826-the man hand was on the door . The door opened . An angle of light fell across the wash- stand . The jug and basin were lit up . [The man]826-the man was actually in [the room]577-the room with [her]204-rose . . . but it was [Eleanor]276-eleanor .

" Why are n't [you]826-the man asleep ? "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor . [She]276-eleanor put down [her]276-eleanor candle and began to straighten the bedclothes . [They]967-they were all crumpled up . [She]276-eleanor looked at [Rose]204-rose . [Her]204-rose eyes were very bright and [her]204-rose cheeks were flushed . What was the matter ? Had [they]968-they woken [her]204-rose , moving about [downstairs]969-downstairs in [[Mama]206-mama 's room]970-mama 's room ?

" What 's been keeping [you]204-rose awake ? "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor asked . [Rose]204-rose yawned again ; but it was a sigh rather than a yawn . [She]204-rose could not tell [Eleanor]276-eleanor what [she]204-rose had seen . [She]204-rose had a profound feeling of guilt ; for some reason [she]204-rose must lie about the face [she]204-rose had seen .

" [I]204-rose had a bad dream , "[204-rose] [she]204-rose said . " [I]204-rose was frightened . "[204-rose] A queer nervous jerk ran through [her]204-rose body as [she]204-rose sat up in bed . What was the matter ? [Eleanor]276-eleanor wondered , again . Had [she]204-rose been fighting with [Martin]205-martin ? Had [she]204-rose been chasing cats in [[Miss Pym]218-miss pym 's garden]971-miss pym 's garden again ?

" Have [you]205-martin been chasing cats again ? "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor asked . " Poor cats , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor added ; " [they]5205-they mind it just as much as [you]205-martin would , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said . But [she]276-eleanor knew that [Rose]204-rose 's fright had nothing to do with the cats . [She]204-rose was grasping [her]204-rose finger tightly ; [she]204-rose was staring ahead of [her]204-rose with a queer look in [her]204-rose eyes .

" What was [your]204-rose dream about ? "[204-rose] [she]204-rose asked , sitting down on the edge of the bed . [Rose]204-rose stared at [her]204-rose ; [she]204-rose could not tell [her]204-rose ; but at all costs [Eleanor]276-eleanor must be made to stay with [her]204-rose .

" [I]204-rose thought [I]204-rose heard [a man]814-a man in [the room]577-the room , "[204-rose] [she]204-rose brought out at last . " [A robber]5208-a robber , "[204-rose] [she]204-rose added .

" [A robber]5208-a robber ? Here ? "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor . " But [Rose]204-rose , how could [a robber]5208-a robber get into [[your]204-rose nursery]5211-your nursery ? " No , "[204-rose] said [Rose]204-rose . " [Papa]207-papa would kill [him]5208-a robber , "[204-rose] [she]204-rose added . There was something queer about the way [she]204-rose twitched .

" But what are [you]973-you all doing ? "[204-rose] [she]204-rose said restlessly . " Have n't [you]973-you gone to bed yet ? Is n't it very late ? "[204-rose]

" What are [we]973-you all doing ? "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor . " [We]973-you 're sitting in [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room . It 's not very late . "[276-eleanor] As [she]204-rose spoke a faint sound boomed through [the room]577-the room . When the wind was in the right direction [they]973-you could hear [St. Paul]248-paul 's . The soft circles spread out in the air : one , two , three , four - [Eleanor]276-eleanor counted eight , nine , ten . [She]276-eleanor was surprised that the strokes stopped so soon .

" There , it 's only ten o'clock , [you]204-rose see , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said . It had seemed to [her]276-eleanor much later . But the last stroke dissolved in the air . " So now [you]204-rose 'll go to sleep , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said . [Rose]204-rose clutched [her]204-rose hand .

" Turn over and go to sleep , [dearie]5218-dearie , "[203-nurse] [she]203-nurse said , kissing [Rose]204-rose on the forehead .
