" [I]276-eleanor saw , "[276-eleanor] [Eleanor]276-eleanor repeated , as [she]276-eleanor shut the nursery door . " [I]276-eleanor saw . . . "[276-eleanor] What had [she]276-eleanor seen ? Something horrible , something hidden . But what ? There it was , hidden behind [her]276-eleanor strained eyes . [She]276-eleanor held the candle slightly slanting in [her]276-eleanor hand . Three drops of grease fell on the polished skirting before [she]276-eleanor noticed them . [She]276-eleanor straightened the candle and walked down [the stairs]573-the stairs . [She]276-eleanor listened as [she]276-eleanor went . There was silence . [Martin]205-martin was asleep . [[Her]276-eleanor mother]685-her mother was asleep . As [she]276-eleanor passed the doors and went [downstairs]969-downstairs a weight seemed to descend on [her]276-eleanor . [She]276-eleanor paused , looking down into [the hall]638-the hall . A blankness came over [her]276-eleanor . Where am [I]0-i ? [she]276-eleanor asked [herself]276-eleanor , staring at a heavy frame . What is that ? [She]276-eleanor seemed to be alone in the midst of nothingness ; yet must descend , must carry [her]276-eleanor burden - [she]276-eleanor raised [her]276-eleanor arms slightly , as if [she]276-eleanor were carrying a pitcher , an earthenware pitcher on [her]276-eleanor head . Again [she]276-eleanor stopped . The rim of a bowl outlined itself upon [her]276-eleanor eyeballs ; there was water in it ; and something yellow . It was the dog 's bowl , [she]276-eleanor realised ; that was the sulphur in the dog 's bowl ; the dog was lying curled up at the bottom of the stairs . [She]276-eleanor stepped carefully over the body of the sleeping dog and went into [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room .

[They]988-they all looked up as [she]276-eleanor came in ; [Morris]237-morris had a book in [his]237-morris hand but [he]237-morris was not reading ; [Milly]200-milly had some stuff in [her]200-milly hand but [she]200-milly was not sewing ; [Delia]201-delia was lying back in [her]201-delia chair , doing nothing whatever . [She]276-eleanor stood there hesitating for a moment . Then [she]276-eleanor turned to the writing - table . " [I]276-eleanor 'll write to [Edward]215-edward , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor murmured . [She]276-eleanor took up the pen , but [she]276-eleanor hesitated . [She]276-eleanor found it difficult to write to [Edward]215-edward , seeing [him]215-edward before [her]276-eleanor , when [she]276-eleanor took up the pen , when [she]276-eleanor smoothed the notepaper on the writing - table . [His]215-edward eyes were too close together ; [he]215-edward brushed up [his]215-edward crest before the looking - glass in [the lobby]989-the lobby in a way that irritated [her]276-eleanor . ' [Nigs]249-nigs ' was [her]276-eleanor nickname for [him]215-edward . " [[My]276-eleanor dear]5173-my dear [Edward]215-edward , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor began to write , choosing ' [Edward]215-edward ' not ' [Nigs]249-nigs ' on this occasion .

[Morris]237-morris looked up from the book [he]237-morris was trying to read . The scratching of [Eleanor]276-eleanor 's pen irritated [him]237-morris . [She]276-eleanor stopped ; then [she]276-eleanor wrote ; then [she]276-eleanor put [her]276-eleanor hand to [her]276-eleanor head . All the worries were put on [her]276-eleanor of course . Still [she]276-eleanor irritated [him]237-morris . [She]276-eleanor always asked questions ; [she]276-eleanor never listened to the answers . [He]237-morris glanced at [his]237-morris book again . But what was the use of trying to read ? The atmosphere of suppressed emotion was distasteful to [him]237-morris . There was nothing that [anybody]990-anybody could do , but there [they]991-they all sat in attitudes of suppressed emotion . [Milly]200-milly 's stitching irritated [him]237-morris , and [Delia]201-delia lying back in [her]201-delia chair doing nothing as usual . There [he]237-morris was cooped up with all [these women]992-these women in an atmosphere of unreal emotion . And [Eleanor]276-eleanor went on writing , writing , writing . There was nothing to write about - but here [she]276-eleanor licked the envelope and dabbed down the stamp .

" Shall [I]237-morris take it ? "[237-morris] [he]237-morris said , dropping [his]237-morris book .

[He]237-morris got up as if [he]237-morris were glad to have something to do . [Eleanor]276-eleanor went to the front door with [him]237-morris and stood holding it open while [he]237-morris went to the pillar - box . It was raining gently , and as [she]276-eleanor stood at the door , breathing in the mild damp air , [she]276-eleanor watched the curious shadows that trembled on the pavement under the trees . [Morris]237-morris disappeared under the shadows round the corner . [She]276-eleanor remembered how [she]276-eleanor used to stand at the door when [he]237-morris was [a small boy]993-a small boy and went to a day school with a satchel in [his]237-morris hand . [She]276-eleanor used to wave to [him]237-morris ; and when [he]237-morris got to the corner [he]237-morris always turned and waved back . It was a curious little ceremony , dropped now that [they]994-they were both grown up . The shadows shook as [she]276-eleanor stood waiting ; in a moment [he]237-morris emerged from the shadows . [He]237-morris came along [the street]587-the street and up the steps .

" [He]237-morris 'll get that tomorrow , "[237-morris] [he]237-morris said - " anyhow by the second post . "[237-morris]

[He]237-morris shut the door and stooped to fasten the chain . It seemed to [her]276-eleanor , as the chain rattled , that [they]994-they both accepted the fact that nothing more was going to happen tonight . [They]994-they avoided [each other]996-each other 's eyes ; neither of [them]994-they wanted any more emotion tonight . [They]994-they went back into [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room .

" Well , "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor , looking round [her]276-eleanor , " [I]276-eleanor think [I]276-eleanor shall go to bed . [Nurse]777-nurse will ring , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , " if [she]777-nurse wants anything . "[276-eleanor]

" [We]994-they may as well all go , "[237-morris] said [Morris]237-morris . [Milly]200-milly began to roll up [her]200-milly embroidery . [Morris]237-morris began to rake out the fire .

" What an absurd fire - "[237-morris] [he]237-morris exclaimed irritably . The coals were all stuck together . [They]998-they were blazing fiercely .

Suddenly a bell rang .

" [Nurse]777-nurse ! "[276-eleanor] [Eleanor]276-eleanor exclaimed . [She]276-eleanor looked at [Morris]237-morris . [She]276-eleanor left [the room]577-the room hurriedly . [Morris]237-morris followed [her]276-eleanor .

But what 's the good ? [Delia]201-delia thought to [herself]201-delia . It 's only another false alarm . [She]201-delia got up . " It 's only [Nurse]203-nurse , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said to [Milly]200-milly , who was standing up with a look of alarm on [her]200-milly face . [She]201-delia ca n't be going to cry again , [she]201-delia thought , and strolled off into [the front room]723-the front room . Candles were burning on the mantelpiece ; they lit up the picture of [[her]201-delia mother]685-her mother . [She]201-delia glanced at the portrait of [[her]201-delia mother]685-her mother . [The girl in white]1003-the girl in white seemed to be presiding over the protracted affair of [her]1003-the girl in white own deathbed with a smiling indifference that outraged [[her]1003-the girl in white daughter]762-her daughter .

" [You]201-delia 're not going to die - [you]201-delia 're not going to die ! "[201-delia] said [Delia]201-delia bitterly , looking up at [her]1003-the girl in white . [[Her]201-delia father]643-her father , alarmed by the bell , had come into [the room]577-the room . [He]643-her father was wearing a red smoking - cap with an absurd tassel .

But it 's all for nothing , [Delia]201-delia said silently , looking at [[her]201-delia father]643-her father . [She]201-delia felt that [they]1008-they must both check [their]1008-they rising excitement . " Nothing 's going to happen - nothing whatever , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said , looking at [him]643-her father . But at that moment [Eleanor]276-eleanor came into [the room]577-the room . [She]276-eleanor was very white .

" Where 's [Papa]207-papa ? "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , looking round . [She]276-eleanor saw [him]643-her father . " Come , [Papa]207-papa , come , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , stretching out [her]276-eleanor hand . " [Mama]5222-mama 's dying . . . . And [the children]555-the children , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said to [Milly]200-milly over [her]276-eleanor shoulder .

Two little white patches appeared above [[her]201-delia father]643-her father 's ears , [Delia]201-delia noticed . [His]643-her father eyes fixed themselves . [He]643-her father braced [himself]643-her father . [He]643-her father strode past [them]1011-them up [the stairs]573-the stairs . [They]1011-them all followed in a little procession behind . The dog , [Delia]201-delia noticed , tried to come [upstairs]684-upstairs with [them]1011-them ; but [Morris]237-morris cuffed [him]643-her father back . [The Colonel]583-the colonel went first into [the bedroom]737-the bedroom ; then [Eleanor]276-eleanor ; then [Morris]237-morris ; then [Martin]205-martin came down , pulling on a dressing - gown ; then [Milly]200-milly brought [Rose]204-rose wrapped in a shawl . But [Delia]201-delia hung back behind [the others]535-the others . There were so many of [them]535-the others in [the room]577-the room that [she]201-delia could get no further than the doorway . [She]201-delia could see [two nurses]1018-two nurses standing with [their]1018-two nurses backs to the wall opposite . [One of [them]1018-two nurses]1019-one of them was crying - the one , [she]201-delia observed , who had only come that afternoon . [She]201-delia could not see the bed from where [she]201-delia stood . But [she]201-delia could see that [Morris]237-morris had fallen on [his]237-morris knees . Ought [I]0-i to kneel too ? [she]201-delia wondered . Not in [the passage]738-the passage , [she]201-delia decided . [She]201-delia looked away ; [she]201-delia saw the little window at the end of [the passage]738-the passage . Rain was falling ; there was a light somewhere that made the raindrops shine . One drop after another slid down the pane ; [they]1018-two nurses slid and [they]1018-two nurses paused ; one drop joined another drop and then [they]1018-two nurses slid again . There was complete silence in [the bedroom]737-the bedroom .

Is this death ? [Delia]201-delia asked [herself]201-delia . For a moment there seemed to be something there . A wall of water seemed to gape apart ; the two walls held themselves apart . [She]201-delia listened . There was complete silence . Then there was a stir , a shuffle of feet in [the bedroom]737-the bedroom and out came [[her]201-delia father]643-her father , stumbling .

" [Rose]204-rose ! "[643-her father] [he]643-her father cried . " [Rose]204-rose ! [Rose]204-rose ! "[643-her father] [He]643-her father held [his]643-her father arms with the fists clenched out in front of [him]643-her father .

[You]643-her father did that very well , [Delia]201-delia told [him]643-her father as [he]643-her father passed [her]201-delia . It was like a scene in a play . [She]201-delia observed quite dispassionately that the raindrops were still falling . One sliding met another and together in one drop [they]1025-they rolled to the bottom of the window - pane .

It was raining . A fine rain , a gentle shower , was peppering the pavements and making them greasy . Was it worth while opening an umbrella , was it necessary to hail a hansom , [people]503-people coming out from [the theatres]1027-the theatres asked [themselves]503-people , looking up at the mild , milky sky in which the stars were blunted . Where it fell on earth , on [fields]1028-fields and [gardens]1029-gardens , it drew up the smell of earth . Here a drop poised on a grass - blade ; there filled the cup of a wild flower , till the breeze stirred and the rain was spilt . Was it worth while to shelter under the hawthorn , under the hedge , the sheep seemed to question ; and the cows , already turned out in [the grey fields]1030-the grey fields , under the dim hedges , munched on , sleepily chewing with raindrops on [their]1031-their hides . Down on the roofs it fell - here in [Westminster]19-westminster , there in [the Ladbroke Grove]27-the ladbroke grove ; on [the wide sea]1032-the wide sea a million points pricked the blue monster like an innumerable shower bath . Over the vast domes , the soaring spires of [slumbering University cities]1033-slumbering university cities , over [the leaded libraries]1034-the leaded libraries , and [the museums]1035-the museums , now shrouded in brown holland , the gentle rain slid down , till , reaching the mouths of [those fantastic laughers]1036-those fantastic laughers , the many - clawed gargoyles , it splayed out in a thousand odd indentations . [A drunken man]1037-a drunken man slipping in [a narrow passage outside [the public house]1039-the public house]1038-a narrow passage outside the public house , cursed it . [Women in childbirth]1040-women in childbirth heard [the doctor]1041-the doctor say to [the midwife]1042-the midwife , " It 's raining . "[1041-the doctor] And the walloping Oxford bells , turning over and over like slow porpoises in a sea of oil , contemplatively intoned [their]503-people musical incantation . The fine rain , the gentle rain , poured equally over the mitred and the bareheaded with an impartiality which suggested that [the god of rain]1043-the god of rain , if there were [a god]1044-a god , was thinking Let it not be restricted to [the very wise]1045-the very wise , the very great , but let [all breathing kind]1046-all breathing kind , [the munchers]1047-the munchers and [chewers]1048-chewers , [the ignorant]1049-the ignorant , [the unhappy]1050-the unhappy , [those who toil in the furnace making innumerable copies of the same pot]1051-those who toil in the furnace making innumerable copies of the same pot , [those who bore red hot minds through contorted letters]1052-those who bore red hot minds through contorted letters , and also [Mrs Jones]250-mrs jones in [the alley]1053-the alley , share [my]0-i bounty .

It was raining in [Oxford]28-oxford . The rain fell gently , persistently , making a little chuckling and burbling noise in the gutters . [Edward]215-edward , leaning out of the window , could still see the trees in [the college garden]1054-the college garden , whitened by the falling rain . Save for the rustle of the trees and the rain falling , it was perfectly quiet . A damp , earthy smell came up from the wet ground . Lamps were being lit here and there in the dark mass of [the college]1055-the college ; and there was a pale - yellowish mound in one corner where lamplight fell upon a flowering tree . The grass was becoming invisible , fluid , grey , like water .

[He]215-edward drew in a long breath of satisfaction . Of all the moments in the day [he]215-edward liked this best , when [he]215-edward stood and looked out into [the garden]5163-the garden . [He]215-edward breathed in again the cool damp air , and then straightened [himself]215-edward and turned back into [the room]577-the room . [He]215-edward was working very hard . [His]215-edward day was parcelled out on the advice of [[his]215-edward tutor]1058-his tutor into hours and half - hours ; but [he]215-edward still had five minutes before [he]215-edward need begin . [He]215-edward turned up the reading - lamp . It was partly the green light that made [him]215-edward look a little pale and thin , but [he]215-edward was very handsome . With [his]215-edward clear - cut features and the fair hair that [he]215-edward brushed up with a flick of [his]215-edward fingers into a crest , [he]215-edward looked like [a Greek boy on a frieze]1059-a greek boy on a frieze . [He]215-edward smiled . [He]215-edward was thinking as [he]215-edward watched the rain how , after the interview between [[his]215-edward father]639-his father and [[his]215-edward tutor]1058-his tutor - when [old Harbottle]251-old harbottle had said " [[Your]215-edward son]5224-your son has a chance "[251-old harbottle] - [the old boy]584-the old boy had insisted upon looking up [the rooms that [[his]215-edward own father]1064-his own father had had when [[his]215-edward father]639-his father was at [college]1066-college]1063-the rooms that his own father had had when his father was at college . [They]1067-they had burst in and found [a chap called [Thompson]252-thompson on [his]252-thompson knees blowing up the fire with a bellows]1068-a chap called thompson on his knees blowing up the fire with a bellows .

" [[My]583-the colonel father]5225-my father had [these rooms]5226-these rooms , [sir]5200-sir , "[583-the colonel] [the Colonel]583-the colonel had said , by way of apology . [The young man]713-the young man had got very red and said , " Do n't mention it . "[713-the young man] [Edward]215-edward smiled . " Do n't mention it , "[215-edward] [he]215-edward repeated . It was time to begin . [He]215-edward turned the lamp a little higher . When the lamp was turned higher [he]215-edward saw [his]215-edward work cut out in a sharp circle of bright light from the surrounding dimness . [He]215-edward looked at the textbooks , at the dictionaries lying before [him]215-edward . [He]215-edward always had some doubts before [he]215-edward began . [[His]215-edward father]639-his father would be frightfully cut - up if [he]215-edward failed . [His]215-edward heart was set on it . [He]639-his father had sent [him]215-edward a dozen of [fine old port]1072-fine old port " by way of a stirrup - cup , "[215-edward] so [he]215-edward said . But after all [Marsham]253-marsham was in for it ; then there was [the clever little Jew - boy from [Birmingham]29-birmingham]1073-the clever little jew - boy from birmingham - but it was time to begin . One after another the bells of [Oxford]28-oxford began pushing [their]1074-their slow chimes through the air . [They]1074-their tolled ponderously , unequally , as if [they]1074-their had to roll the air out of [their]1074-their way and the air was heavy . [He]215-edward loved the sound of the bells . [He]215-edward listened till the last stroke had struck ; then pulled [his]215-edward chair to the table ; time was up ; [he]215-edward must work now .

A little dint sharpened between [his]215-edward brows . [He]215-edward frowned as [he]215-edward read . [He]215-edward read ; and made a note ; then [he]215-edward read again . All sounds were blotted out . [He]215-edward saw nothing but the Greek in front of [him]215-edward . But as [he]215-edward read , [his]215-edward brain gradually warmed ; [he]215-edward was conscious of something quickening and tightening in [his]215-edward forehead . [He]215-edward caught phrase after phrase exactly , firmly , more exactly , [he]215-edward noted , making a brief note in the margin , than the night before . Little negligible words now revealed shade of meaning which altered the meaning . [He]215-edward made another note ; THAT was the meaning . [His]215-edward own dexterity in catching the phrase plumb in the middle gave [him]215-edward a thrill of excitement . There it was , clean and entire . But [he]215-edward must be precise ; exact ; even [his]215-edward little scribbled notes must be clear as print . [He]215-edward turned to this book ; then that book . Then [he]215-edward leant back to see , with [his]215-edward eyes shut . [He]215-edward must let nothing dwindle off into vagueness . The clocks began striking . [He]215-edward listened . The clocks went on striking . The lines that had graved themselves on [his]215-edward face slackened ; [he]215-edward leant back ; [his]215-edward muscles relaxed ; [he]215-edward looked up from [his]215-edward books into the dimness . [He]215-edward felt as if [he]215-edward had thrown [himself]215-edward down on the turf after running a race . But for a moment it seemed to [him]215-edward that [he]215-edward was still running ; [his]215-edward mind went on without the book . It travelled by itself without impediments through a world of pure meaning ; but gradually it lost its meaning . The books stood out on the wall : [he]215-edward saw the cream - coloured panels ; a bunch of poppies in a blue vase . The last of the strokes had sounded . [He]215-edward gave a sigh and rose from the table .

[He]215-edward stood by the window again . It was raining , but the whiteness had gone . Save for a wet leaf shining here and there , [the garden]5163-the garden was all dark now - the yellow mound of the flowering tree had vanished . [The college buildings]1076-the college buildings lay round [the garden]5163-the garden in a low couched mass , here red - stained , here yellow - stained , where lights burnt behind curtains ; and there lay [the chapel]1078-the chapel , huddling its bulk against the sky which , because of the rain , seemed to tremble slightly . But it was no longer silent . [He]215-edward listened ; there was no sound in particular ; but , as [he]215-edward stood looking out , [the building]1079-the building hummed with life . There was a sudden roar of laughter ; then the tinkle of a piano ; then a nondescript clatter and chatter - of china partly ; then again the sound of rain falling , and the gutters chuckling and burbling as [they]1080-they sucked up the water . [He]215-edward turned back into [the room]577-the room .

It had grown chilly ; the fire was almost out ; only a little red glowed under the grey ash . Opportunely [he]215-edward remembered [[his]215-edward father]639-his father 's gift - the wine that had come that morning . [He]215-edward went to the side table and poured [himself]215-edward out a glass of port . As [he]215-edward raised it against the light [he]215-edward smiled . [He]215-edward saw again [[his]215-edward father]639-his father 's hand with two smooth knobs instead of fingers holding the glass , as [he]639-his father always held the glass , to the light before [he]639-his father drank .

" [You]215-edward ca n't drive a bayonet through [a chap]5228-a chap 's body in cold blood , "[639-his father] [he]215-edward remembered [him]639-his father saying .

" And [you]215-edward ca n't go in for an exam . without drinking , "[215-edward] said [Edward]215-edward . [He]215-edward hesitated ; [he]215-edward held the glass to the light in imitation of [[his]215-edward father]639-his father . Then [he]215-edward sipped . [He]215-edward set the glass on the table in front of [him]215-edward . [He]215-edward turned again to the Antigone . [He]215-edward read ; then [he]215-edward sipped ; then [he]215-edward read ; then [he]215-edward sipped again . A soft glow spread over [his]215-edward spine at the nape of [his]215-edward neck . The wine seemed to press open little dividing doors in [his]215-edward brain . And whether it was the wine or the words or both , a luminous shell formed , a purple fume , from which out stepped [a Greek girl]1085-a greek girl ; yet [she]1085-a greek girl was English . There [she]1085-a greek girl stood among the marble and the asphodel , yet there [she]1085-a greek girl was among the Morris wall - papers and the cabinets - [[his]215-edward cousin]1086-his cousin [Kitty]254-kitty , as [he]215-edward had seen [her]254-kitty last time [he]215-edward dined at [the lodge]1087-the lodge . [She]1088-she was both of [them]1088-she - Antigone and [Kitty]254-kitty ; here in the book ; there in [the room]577-the room ; lit up , risen , like a purple flower . No , [he]215-edward exclaimed , not in the least like a flower ! For if ever [a girl]1090-a girl held [herself]1090-a girl upright , lived , laughed and breathed , it was [Kitty]254-kitty , in the white and blue dress that [she]1090-a girl had worn last time [he]215-edward dined at [the Lodge]1087-the lodge . [He]215-edward crossed to the window . Red squares showed through the trees . There was a party at [the Lodge]1087-the lodge . Who was [she]1090-a girl talking to ? What was [she]1090-a girl saying ? [He]215-edward went back to the table .

" Oh , damn ! "[215-edward] [he]215-edward exclaimed , prodding the paper with [his]215-edward pencil . The point broke . Then there was a tap at the door , a sliding tap , not a commanding tap , the tap of one who passes , not of [one who comes in]1093-one who comes in . [He]215-edward went and opened the door . There on the stair above loomed the figure of [a huge young man who was leaning over the banisters]1094-a huge young man who was leaning over the banisters . " Come in , "[215-edward] said [Edward]215-edward .

[The huge young man]1095-the huge young man came slowly down [the stairs]573-the stairs . [He]1095-the huge young man was very large . [His]1095-the huge young man eyes , which were prominent , became apprehensive at the sight of the books on the table . [He]1095-the huge young man looked at the books on the table . They were Greek . But there was wine after all .

[Edward]215-edward poured out wine . Beside [Gibbs]255-gibbs [he]215-edward looked what [Eleanor]276-eleanor called ' finicky . ' [He]215-edward felt the contrast [himself]215-edward . The hand with which [he]215-edward lifted [his]215-edward glass was like [a girl]1090-a girl 's beside [Gibbs]255-gibbs 's great red paw . [Gibbs]255-gibbs 's hand was burnt bright scarlet ; it was like a piece of raw meat .

Hunting was the subject [they]1098-they had in common . [They]1098-they talked about hunting . [Edward]215-edward leant back and let [Gibbs]255-gibbs do the talking . It was all very pleasant , listening to [Gibbs]255-gibbs , riding through [these English lanes]1099-these english lanes . [He]255-gibbs was talking about cubbing in [September]30-september ; and a raw but handy hack . [He]255-gibbs was saying , " [You]215-edward remember [that farm on the right as [you]215-edward go up to [Stapleys]256-stapleys]5229-that farm on the right as you go up to stapleys ? and [the pretty girl]5230-the pretty girl ? "[255-gibbs] - [he]255-gibbs winked - " worse luck , [she]5230-the pretty girl 's married to [a keeper]5231-a keeper . "[255-gibbs] [He]255-gibbs was saying - [Edward]215-edward watched [him]255-gibbs gulping down [his]255-gibbs port - how [he]255-gibbs wished this damned summer were over . Then , again , [he]255-gibbs was telling the old story about [the spaniel bitch]1100-the spaniel bitch . " [You]257-ashley 'll come and stop with [us]5232-us in September , "[255-gibbs] [he]255-gibbs was saying when the door opened so silently that [Gibbs]255-gibbs did not hear it , and in glided [another man]544-another man - quite [another man]544-another man .

It was [Ashley]257-ashley who came in . [He]257-ashley was the very opposite of [Gibbs]255-gibbs . [He]257-ashley was neither tall nor short , neither dark nor fair . But [he]257-ashley was not negligible - far from it . It was partly the way [he]257-ashley moved , as if chair and table rayed out some influence which [he]257-ashley could feel by means of some invisible antennae , or whiskers , like a cat . Now [he]257-ashley sank down , cautiously , gingerly , and looked at the table and half read a line in a book . [Gibbs]255-gibbs stopped in the middle of [his]255-gibbs sentence .

" Hullo , [Ashley]257-ashley , "[255-gibbs] [he]255-gibbs said rather curtly . [He]255-gibbs stretched out and poured [himself]255-gibbs another glass of [the Colonel]583-the colonel 's port . Now the decanter was empty .

" Sorry , "[255-gibbs] [he]255-gibbs said , glancing at [Ashley]257-ashley .

" Do n't open another bottle for [me]257-ashley , "[257-ashley] said [Ashley]257-ashley quickly . [His]257-ashley voice sounded a little squeaky , as if [he]257-ashley were ill at ease .

" Oh , but [we]5233-we shall want some more too , "[215-edward] said [Edward]215-edward casually . [He]215-edward went into [the dining - room]882-the dining - room to fetch it .

" Damned awkward , "[215-edward] [he]215-edward reflected as [he]215-edward stooped among the bottles . It meant , [he]215-edward reflected grimly as [he]215-edward chose [his]215-edward bottle , another row with [Ashley]257-ashley , and [he]215-edward had had two rows with [Ashley]257-ashley about [Gibbs]255-gibbs already this term .

[He]215-edward went back with the bottle and sat down on a low stool between [them]1105-they . [He]215-edward uncorked the wine and poured it out . [They]1105-they both looked at [him]215-edward , as [he]215-edward sat between [them]1105-they , admiringly . The vanity , which [Eleanor]276-eleanor always laughed at in [[her]276-eleanor brother]1106-her brother , was flattered . [He]215-edward liked to feel [their]1105-they eyes on [him]215-edward . And yet [he]215-edward was at [his]215-edward ease with [both of [them]1105-they]1107-both of them , [he]215-edward thought ; the thought pleased [him]215-edward ; [he]215-edward could talk hunting with [Gibbs]255-gibbs and books with [Ashley]257-ashley . But [Ashley]257-ashley could only talk about books , and [Gibbs]255-gibbs - [he]255-gibbs smiled - could only talk about [girls]5202-girls . [Girls]5202-girls and horses . [He]255-gibbs poured out three glasses of wine .

[Ashley]257-ashley sipped gingerly , and [Gibbs]255-gibbs , with [his]255-gibbs great red hands on the glass , gulped rather . [They]1105-they talked about races ; then [they]1105-they talked about examinations . Then [Ashley]257-ashley , glancing at the books on the table , said :

" And what about [you]215-edward ? "[257-ashley]

" [I]215-edward 've not the ghost of a chance , "[215-edward] said [Edward]215-edward . [His]215-edward indifference was affected . [He]215-edward pretended to despise examinations ; but it was pretence . [Gibbs]255-gibbs was taken in by [him]215-edward ; but [Ashley]257-ashley saw through [him]255-gibbs . [He]257-ashley often caught [Edward]215-edward out in small vanities like this ; but they only served to endear [him]215-edward the more . How beautiful [he]215-edward looks , [he]257-ashley was thinking : there [he]215-edward sat between [them]1105-they with the light falling on the top of [his]215-edward fair hair ; like [a Greek boy]1110-a greek boy ; strong ; yet in some way , weak , needing [his]215-edward protection .

[He]215-edward ought to be rescued from brutes like [Gibbs]255-gibbs , [he]257-ashley thought savagely . For how [Edward]215-edward could tolerate [that clumsy brute]1111-that clumsy brute , [he]257-ashley thought looking at [him]215-edward , who always seemed to smell of beer and horses [he]215-edward was listening to [him]215-edward [Ashley]257-ashley could not conceive . As [he]257-ashley came in [he]257-ashley had caught the tail of an infuriating sentence - of a sentence that seemed to show that [they]1105-they had made some plan together .

" Well , then , [I]255-gibbs 'll see [Storey]258-storey about that hack , "[255-gibbs] [Gibbs]255-gibbs was saying now , as if [he]255-gibbs were finishing some private talk that [they]1105-they had been having before [he]255-gibbs came in . A spasm of jealousy ran through [Ashley]257-ashley . To hide it , [he]257-ashley stretched out [his]257-ashley hand and took up a book that lay open on the table . [He]257-ashley pretended to read it .

[He]257-ashley did it to insult [him]255-gibbs , [Gibbs]255-gibbs felt . [Ashley]257-ashley , [he]257-ashley knew , thought [him]255-gibbs [a great hulking brute]1112-a great hulking brute ; [the dirty little swine]1113-the dirty little swine came in , spoilt the talk , and then began to give [himself]1113-the dirty little swine airs at [Gibbs]255-gibbs 's expense . Very well ; [he]257-ashley had been going to go ; now [he]257-ashley would stay ; [he]257-ashley would twist [his]257-ashley tail for [him]255-gibbs - [he]257-ashley knew how . [He]257-ashley turned to [Edward]215-edward and went on talking .

" [You]215-edward wo n't mind pigging it , "[257-ashley] [he]257-ashley said . " [[My]257-ashley people]5234-my people will be up in [Scotland]31-scotland . "[257-ashley]

[Ashley]257-ashley turned a page viciously . [They]1114-they would be alone then . [Edward]215-edward began to relish the situation ; [he]215-edward played up to it maliciously .

" All right , "[215-edward] [he]215-edward said . " But [you]257-ashley 'll have to see [I]257-ashley do n't make a fool of [myself]257-ashley , "[257-ashley] [he]257-ashley added .

" Oh , it 'll only be cubbing , "[255-gibbs] said [Gibbs]255-gibbs . [Ashley]257-ashley turned another page . [Edward]215-edward glanced at the book . It was being held upside down . But as [he]215-edward glanced at [Ashley]257-ashley [he]215-edward caught [his]215-edward head against the panels and the poppies . How civilised [he]215-edward looked , [he]215-edward thought , compared with [Gibbs]255-gibbs ; and how ironical . [He]215-edward respected [him]215-edward immensely . [Gibbs]255-gibbs had lost [his]255-gibbs glamour . There [he]255-gibbs was , telling the same old story of [the spaniel bitch]1100-the spaniel bitch all over again . There would be a devil 's own row tomorrow , [he]255-gibbs thought , and glanced surreptitiously at [his]255-gibbs watch . It was past eleven ; and [he]255-gibbs must do an hour 's work before breakfast . [He]255-gibbs swallowed down the last drops of [his]255-gibbs wine , stretched [himself]255-gibbs , yawned ostentatiously and rose .

" [I]255-gibbs 'm off to bed , "[255-gibbs] [he]255-gibbs said . [Ashley]257-ashley looked at [him]255-gibbs appealingly . [Edward]215-edward could torture [him]255-gibbs horribly . [Edward]215-edward began unbuttoning [his]215-edward waistcoat ; [he]215-edward had a perfect figure , [Ashley]257-ashley thought , looking at [him]215-edward , standing between [them]1116-them .

" [Edward]215-edward ! "[257-ashley] said [Ashley]257-ashley . [His]257-ashley voice was low and controlled .

The rain fell steadily all night long , making a faint mist over [the fields]502-the fields , chuckling and burbling in the gutters . In [gardens]1029-gardens it fell over flowering bushes of lilac and laburnum . The sun was shining again ; the damp pavements gleamed ; a gust of wind tossed up the wet branches of the almond trees in [the villa gardens]1308-the villa gardens ; little twigs and tufts of blossom whirled onto the pavement and stuck there . As [she]254-kitty stood still for a second at a crossing [she]254-kitty too seemed to be tossed aloft out of [her]254-kitty usual surroundings . [She]254-kitty forgot where [she]254-kitty was . The bells came pushing forth one after another , [one on top of another]1400-one on top of another , through the damp , heavy air .

" Go to bed , [Kitty]254-kitty , "[263-mrs malone] said [Mrs Malone]263-mrs malone . " [There]576-there ! It 's striking ten . "[263-mrs malone]

" But are n't [you]685-her mother coming too , [Mama]206-mama ? "[254-kitty] said [Kitty]254-kitty , standing beside [her]685-her mother chair .

" [[Your]254-kitty father]5262-your father wo n't be back just yet , "[263-mrs malone] said [Mrs Malone]263-mrs malone , putting on [her]263-mrs malone spectacles again .

[Kitty]254-kitty knew it was useless to try to persuade [her]263-mrs malone . It was part of the mysterious ritual of [[her]254-kitty parents]1344-her parents ' lives . [She]254-kitty bent down and gave [[her]254-kitty mother]685-her mother the little perfunctory peck that was the only sign [they]1344-her parents ever gave each other outwardly of [their]1344-her parents affection . Yet [they]1344-her parents were very fond of [each other]996-each other ; yet [they]1344-her parents always quarrelled .

" Good - night , and sleep well , "[263-mrs malone] said [Mrs Malone]263-mrs malone .

" [I]263-mrs malone do n't like to see [your]254-kitty roses fade , "[263-mrs malone] [she]263-mrs malone added , putting [her]263-mrs malone arm round [her]254-kitty for once in a way .

[She]263-mrs malone sat still after [Kitty]254-kitty had gone . [Rose]204-rose is dead , [she]263-mrs malone thought - [Rose]204-rose who was about [her]204-rose own age . [She]263-mrs malone read the note again . It was from [Edward]215-edward . And [Edward]215-edward , [she]263-mrs malone mused , is in love with [Kitty]254-kitty , but [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i want [her]254-kitty to marry [him]215-edward , [she]263-mrs malone thought , taking up [her]263-mrs malone needle . No , not [Edward]215-edward . . . . There was [young Lord Lasswade]306-young lord lasswade . . . . That would be a nice marriage , [she]263-mrs malone thought . Not that [I]0-i want [her]254-kitty to be rich , not that [I]0-i care about rank , [she]263-mrs malone thought , threading [her]263-mrs malone needle . No , but [he]215-edward could give [her]254-kitty what [she]254-kitty wants . . . . What was it ? . . . Scope , [she]263-mrs malone decided , beginning to stitch . Then again [her]263-mrs malone thoughts turned to [Rose]204-rose . [Rose]204-rose was dead . [Rose]204-rose who was about [her]204-rose own age . That must have been the first time [he]215-edward proposed to [her]204-rose , [she]263-mrs malone thought , the day [we]1404-they had the picnic on [the moors]5250-the moors . It was a spring day . [They]1404-they were sitting on the grass . [She]263-mrs malone could see [Rose]204-rose wearing a black hat with a cock 's feather in it over [her]204-rose bright red hair . [She]263-mrs malone could still see [her]204-rose blush and look extremely pretty when [Abel]191-abel rode up , much to [their]1404-they surprise - [he]191-abel was stationed at [Scarborough]43-scarborough - the day [they]1404-they had the picnic on [the moors]5250-the moors .

[The house at [Abercorn Terrace]18-abercorn terrace]1407-the house at abercorn terrace was very dark . [It]1407-the house at abercorn terrace smelt strongly of spring flowers . For some days now wreaths had been piled one on top of another on the hall table . In the dimness - all the blinds were drawn - the flowers gleamed ; and [the hall]638-the hall smelt with the amorous intensity of [a hot - house]1409-a hot - house . Wreath after wreath , [they]1404-they kept arriving . There were lilies with broad bars of gold in them ; others with spotted throats sticky with honey ; white tulips , white lilac - flowers of all kinds , some with petals as thick as velvet , others transparent , paper - thin ; but all white , and clubbed together , head to head , in circles , in ovals , in crosses so that they scarcely looked like flowers . Black - edged cards were attached to them , " With deep sympathy from [Major]192-major elkin and [Mrs Brand]194-brand "[1410-a messenger boy] ; " With love and sympathy from [General]307-arbuthnot and [Mrs Elkin]308-mrs elkin "[1410-a messenger boy] ; " For dearest [Rose]204-rose from [Susan]309-susan . "[1410-a messenger boy] Each card had a few words written on it .

Even now with the hearse at the door the bell rang ; [a messenger boy]1410-a messenger boy appeared bearing more lilies . [He]1410-a messenger boy raised [his]1410-a messenger boy cap , as [he]1410-a messenger boy stood in [the hall]638-the hall , for [men]1412-men were lurching down the stairs carrying the coffin . [Rose]204-rose , in deep black , prompted by [[her]204-rose nurse]1281-her nurse , stepped forward and dropped [her]204-rose little bunch of violets on the coffin . But it slipped off as it swayed down the brilliant sunlit steps on the slanting shoulders of [[Whiteleys]310-whiteleys ' men]1414-whiteleys ' men . [The family]1415-the family followed after .

It was an uncertain day , with passing shadows and darting rays of bright sunshine . The funeral started at a walking pace . [Delia]201-delia , getting into [the second carriage]1416-the second carriage with [Milly]200-milly and [Edward]215-edward , noticed that [the houses opposite]1417-the houses opposite had [their]1417-the houses opposite blinds drawn in sympathy , but [a servant]1340-a servant peeped . [The others]535-the others , [she]201-delia noticed , did not seem to see [her]201-delia ; [they]535-the others were thinking of [[their]535-the others mother]629-their mother . When [they]535-the others got into [the main road]1421-the main road the pace quickened , for the drive to [the cemetery]1422-the cemetery was a long one . Through the slit of the blind , [Delia]201-delia noticed dogs playing ; [a beggar]1423-a beggar singing ; [men]1412-men raising [their]1412-men hats as [the hearse]1425-the hearse passed [them]1412-men . But by the time [their]535-the others own carriage passed , the hats were on again . [Men]1412-men walked briskly and unconcernedly along [the pavement]570-the pavement . [The shops]1428-the shops were already gay with spring clothing ; [women]1429-women paused and looked in at the windows . But [they]535-the others would have to wear nothing but black all the summer , [Delia]201-delia thought , looking at [Edward]215-edward 's coal - black trousers .

[They]535-the others scarcely spoke , or only in little formal sentences , as if [they]535-the others were already taking part in the ceremony . Somehow [their]535-the others relations had changed . [They]535-the others were more considerate , and a little important too , as if [[their]535-the others mother]629-their mother 's death had laid new responsibilities on [them]535-the others . But [the others]535-the others knew how to behave ; it was only [she]201-delia who had to make an effort . [She]201-delia remained outside , and so did [[her]201-delia father]643-her father , [she]201-delia thought . When [Martin]205-martin suddenly burst out laughing at tea , and then stopped and looked guilty , [she]201-delia felt - that is what [Papa]207-papa would do , that is what [I]0-i should do if [we]1433-we were honest .

[She]201-delia glanced out of the window again . [Another man]544-another man raised [his]544-another man hat - [a tall man]1346-a tall man , [a man in a frock - coat]1436-a man in a frock - coat , but [she]201-delia would not allow [herself]201-delia to think of [Mr Parnell]223-parnell until the funeral was over .

At last [they]1437-they reached [the cemetery]1422-the cemetery . As [she]201-delia took [her]201-delia place in [the little group behind the coffin]1439-the little group behind the coffin and walked up [the church]1440-the church , [she]201-delia was relieved to find that [she]201-delia was overcome by some generalised and solemn emotion . [People]503-people stood up on both sides of [the church]1440-the church and [she]201-delia felt [their]503-people eyes on [her]201-delia . Then the service began . [A clergyman]1443-a clergyman , [a cousin]1444-a cousin , read it . The first words struck out with a rush of extraordinary beauty . [Delia]201-delia , standing behind [[her]201-delia father]643-her father , noticed how [he]643-her father braced [himself]643-her father and squared [his]643-her father shoulders .

" [I]643-her father am the resurrection and the life . "[643-her father]

Pent up as [she]201-delia had been all these days in [the half - lit house which smelt of flowers]1446-the half - lit house which smelt of flowers , the outspoken words filled [her]201-delia with glory . This [she]201-delia could feel genuinely ; this was something that [she]201-delia said [herself]201-delia . But then , as [Cousin James]311-cousin james went on reading , something slipped . The sense was blurred . [She]201-delia could not follow with [her]201-delia reason . Then in the midst of the argument came another burst of familiar beauty . " And fade away suddenly like the grass , in the morning it is green , and groweth up ; but in the evening it is cut down , dried up , and withered . "[201-delia] [She]201-delia could feel the beauty of that . Again it was like music ; but then [Cousin James]311-cousin james seemed to hurry , as if [he]643-her father did not altogether believe what [he]643-her father was saying . [He]643-her father seemed to pass from the known to the unknown ; from what [he]643-her father believed to what [he]643-her father did not believe ; even [his]643-her father voice altered . [He]643-her father looked clean , [he]643-her father looked starched and ironed like [his]643-her father robes . But what did [he]643-her father mean by what [he]643-her father was saying ? [She]201-delia gave it up . Either [one]847-one understood or [one]847-one did not understand , [she]201-delia thought . [Her]201-delia mind wandered .

But [I]0-i will not think of [him]643-her father , [she]201-delia thought , seeing [a tall man who stood beside [her]201-delia on a platform and raised [his]643-her father hat]1449-a tall man who stood beside her on a platform and raised his hat , until it 's over . [She]201-delia fixed [her]201-delia eyes upon [[her]201-delia father]643-her father . [She]201-delia watched [him]643-her father dab a great white pocket - handkerchief to [his]643-her father eyes and put it in [his]643-her father pocket ; then [he]643-her father pulled it out and dabbed [his]643-her father eyes with it again . Then the voice stopped ; [he]643-her father put [his]643-her father handkerchief finally in [his]643-her father pocket ; and again [they]1451-they all formed up , [the little group of [the family]1415-the family]1452-the little group of the family , behind the coffin and again [the dark people on either side]1454-the dark people on either side rose , and watched [them]1452-the little group of the family and let [them]1452-the little group of the family go first and followed after .

It was a relief to feel the soft damp air blowing its leafy smell in [her]201-delia face again . But again now that [she]201-delia was out of doors , [she]201-delia began to notice things . [She]201-delia noticed how the black funeral horses were pawing the ground ; [they]1455-they were scraping little pits with [their]1455-they hooves in the yellow gravel . [She]201-delia remembered hearing that funeral horses came from [Belgium]44-belgium and were very vicious . [They]1455-they looked vicious [she]201-delia thought ; [their]1455-they black necks were flecked with foam - but [she]201-delia recalled [herself]201-delia . [They]1455-they went straggling in ones and twos along [a path]1456-a path until [they]1455-they reached [a fresh mound of yellow earth heaped beside a pit]1457-a fresh mound of yellow earth heaped beside a pit ; and there again [she]201-delia noticed how [the grave - diggers]1458-the grave - diggers stood at a little distance , rather behind , with [their]1458-the grave - diggers spades .

There was a pause ; [people]503-people kept on arriving and took up [their]503-people positions , some a little higher , some a little lower . [She]201-delia observed [a poor - looking shabby woman prowling on the outskirts]1460-a poor - looking shabby woman prowling on the outskirts , and tried to think whether [she]1460-a poor - looking shabby woman prowling on the outskirts were [some old servant]1461-some old servant , but [she]201-delia could not put a name to [her]1460-a poor - looking shabby woman prowling on the outskirts . [[Her]201-delia Uncle]747-her uncle [Digby]224-digby , [[her]201-delia father 's brother]1463-her father 's brother , stood directly opposite [her]201-delia , with [his]224-digby top - hat held like some sacred vessel between [his]224-digby hands , the image of grave decorum . [Some of [the women]1465-the women]1464-some of the women were crying ; but not [the men]1466-the men ; [the men]1466-the men had one pose ; [the women]1465-the women had another , [she]201-delia observed . Then it all began again . The splendid gust of music blew through [them]1469-them - " [Man that is born of [a woman]5302-a woman]5301-man that is born of a woman "[201-delia] : the ceremony had renewed itself ; once more [they]1469-them were grouped , united . [The family]1415-the family pressed a little closer to [the graveside]1471-the graveside and looked fixedly at the coffin which lay with its polish and its brass handles there in the earth to be buried for ever . It looked too new to be buried for ever . [She]201-delia stared down into the grave . There lay [[her]201-delia mother]685-her mother ; in that coffin - [the woman [she]201-delia had loved and hated so]1473-the woman she had loved and hated so . [Her]201-delia eyes dazzled . [She]201-delia was afraid that [she]201-delia might faint ; but [she]201-delia must look ; [she]201-delia must feel ; it was the last chance that was left [her]201-delia . Earth dropped on the coffin ; three pebbles fell on the hard shiny surface ; and as [they]1474-they dropped [she]201-delia was possessed by a sense of something everlasting ; of life mixing with death , of death becoming life . For as [she]201-delia looked [she]201-delia heard the sparrows chirp quicker and quicker ; [she]201-delia heard wheels in the distance sound louder and louder ; life came closer and closer . . . .

" [We]5303-we give [thee]201-delia hearty thanks , "[1475-the voice] said [the voice]1475-the voice , " for that it has pleased [thee]201-delia to deliver [this [our]5303-we sister]5304-this our sister out of the miseries of [this sinful world]5305-this sinful world - "[1475-the voice]

What a lie ! [she]201-delia cried to [herself]201-delia . What a damnable lie ! [He]1476-he had robbed [her]201-delia of the one feeling that was genuine ; [he]1476-he had spoilt [her]201-delia one moment of understanding .

[She]201-delia looked up . [She]201-delia saw [Morris]237-morris and [Eleanor]276-eleanor side by side ; [their]1477-their faces were blurred ; [their]1477-their noses were red ; the tears were running down them . As for [[her]201-delia father]643-her father [he]643-her father was so stiff and so rigid that [she]201-delia had a convulsive desire to laugh aloud . [Nobody]575-nobody can feel like that , [she]201-delia thought . [He]643-her father 's overdoing it . [None of [us]1481-us]1480-none of us feel anything at all , [she]201-delia thought : [we]1481-us 're all pretending .

Then there was a general movement ; the attempt at concentration was over . [People]503-people strolled off this way and that ; there was no attempt now to form into a procession ; [little groups]1483-little groups came together ; [people]503-people shook hands rather furtively , among the graves , and even smiled .

" How good of [you]201-delia to come ! "[215-edward] said [Edward]215-edward , shaking hands with old [Sir James Graham]312-jimmy , who gave [him]215-edward a little pat on the shoulder . Ought [she]201-delia to go and thank [him]215-edward too ? [The graves]1485-the graves made it difficult . It was becoming a shrouded and subdued morning party among [the graves]1485-the graves . [She]201-delia hesitated - [she]201-delia did not know what [she]201-delia ought to do next . [[Her]201-delia father]643-her father had walked on . [She]201-delia looked back . [The grave - diggers]1458-the grave - diggers had come forward ; [they]1458-the grave - diggers were piling the wreaths one on top of another neatly ; and [the prowling woman]1489-the prowling woman had joined [them]1458-the grave - diggers and was stooping down to read the names on the cards . The ceremony was over ; rain was falling .

1891

The autumn wind blew over [England]35-england . It twitched the leaves off the trees , and down they fluttered , spotted red and yellow , or sent them floating , flaunting in wide curves before [they]1490-they settled . In towns coming in gusts round the corners , the wind blew here a hat off ; there lifted a veil high above [a woman]5302-a woman 's head . Money was in brisk circulation . [The streets]1492-the streets were crowded . Upon the sloping desks of [the offices near [St. Paul 's]45-st. paul 's]1493-the offices near st. paul 's , [clerks]1494-clerks paused with [their]1494-clerks pens on the ruled page . It was difficult to work after the holidays . [Margate]46-margate , [Eastbourne]47-eastbourne and [Brighton]48-brighton had bronzed [them]1494-clerks and tanned [them]1494-clerks . The sparrows and starlings , making [their]1458-the grave - diggers discordant chatter round the eaves of [St. Martin 's]49-st. martin 's , whitened the heads of the sleek statues holding rods or rolls of paper in [Parliament Square]50-parliament square . Blowing behind [the boat train]1495-the boat train , the wind ruffled [the channel]1496-the channel , tossed the grapes in [Provence]51-provence , and made [the lazy fisher boy , who was lying on [his]1497-the lazy fisher boy , who was lying on his back in his boat in the mediterranean back in [[his]1497-the lazy fisher boy , who was lying on his back in his boat in the mediterranean boat in [the Mediterranean]52-the mediterranean]1498-his boat in the mediterranean]1497-the lazy fisher boy , who was lying on his back in his boat in the mediterranean , roll over and snatch a rope .

But in [England]35-england , in [the North]383-north , it was cold . [Kitty]254-kitty , [Lady Lasswade]313-lady lasswade , sitting on [the terrace]1499-the terrace beside [[her]254-kitty husband]1135-her husband and [[his]1135-her husband spaniel]1501-his spaniel , drew the cloak round [her]254-kitty shoulders . [She]254-kitty was looking at [the hill top]1502-the hill top , where the snuffer - shaped monument raised by [the old Earl]1503-the old earl made a mark for [ships at]1504-ships at [sea]1505-sea . There was mist on [the woods]1506-the woods . Near at hand [the stone ladies on [the terrace]1499-the terrace]1507-the stone ladies on the terrace had scarlet flowers in [their]1507-the stone ladies on the terrace urns . Thin blue smoke drifted across the flaming dahlias in the long beds that went down to [the river]813-the river . " Burning weeds , "[254-kitty] [she]254-kitty said aloud . Then there was a tap on the window , and [[her]254-kitty little boy in a pink frock]1510-her little boy in a pink frock stumbled out , holding [his]1510-her little boy in a pink frock spotted horse .

[In [Devonshire]54-devonshire where [the round red hills]1512-the round red hills and [the steep valleys]1513-the steep valleys hoarded [the sea]1514-the sea]1511-in devonshire where the round red hills and the steep valleys hoarded the sea air leaves were still thick on the trees - too thick , [Hugh Gibbs]255-gibbs said at breakfast . Too thick for shooting , [he]255-gibbs said , and [Milly]200-milly , [[his]255-gibbs wife]550-his wife , left [him]255-gibbs to go to [[his]255-gibbs meeting]1516-his meeting . With [her]200-milly basket on [her]200-milly arm [she]200-milly walked down [the well - kept crazy pavement]1517-the well - kept crazy pavement with the swaying movement of [a woman with child]1518-a woman with child . There hung the yellow pears on the orchard wall , lifting the leaves over them , they were so swollen . But the wasps had got at [them]1519-them - the skin was broken . With [her]200-milly hand on the fruit [she]200-milly paused . Pop , pop , pop sounded in [the distant woods]1520-the distant woods . [Someone]591-someone was shooting .

The smoke hung in veils over the spires and domes of [the University cities]1522-the university cities . Here it choked the mouth of a gargoyle ; there it clung to the walls that were peeled yellow . [Edward]215-edward , who was taking [his]215-edward brisk constitutional , noted smell , sound and colour ; which suggested how complex impressions are ; [few poets]1523-few poets compress enough ; but there must be some line in Greek or Latin , [he]215-edward was thinking , which sums up the contrast , - when [Mrs Lathom]262-mrs lathom passed [him]215-edward and [he]215-edward raised [his]215-edward cap .

In [the Law Courts]1524-the law courts the leaves lay dry and angular on the flagstones . [Morris]237-morris , remembering [his]237-morris childhood , shuffled [his]237-morris feet through them on [his]237-morris way to [[his]237-morris chambers]1525-his chambers , and [they]1526-they scattered edgeways along the gutters . Not yet trodden down [they]1526-they lay in [Kensington Gardens]55-kensington gardens , and [children]569-children , crunching the shells as [they]569-children ran , scooped up a handful and scudded on through the mist down [the avenues]1528-the avenues , with [their]569-children hoops .

Racing over [the hills in [the country]501-the country]1529-the hills in the country the wind blew vast rings of shadow that dwindled again to green . But in [London]1-london [the streets]1492-the streets narrowed the clouds ; mist hung thick in [the East End]56-the east end by [the river]813-the river ; made the voices of [men]1412-men crying " Any old iron to sell , any old iron , "[1412-men] sound distant ; and in [the suburbs]1534-the suburbs the organs were muted . The wind blew the smoke - for in [every back garden]1535-every back garden in the angle of the ivy- grown wall that still sheltered a few last geraniums , leaves were heaped up ; keen fanged flames were eating them - out into [the street]587-the street , into windows that stood open in [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room in the morning . For it was October , the birth of the year .

[Eleanor]276-eleanor was sitting at [her]276-eleanor writing - table with [her]276-eleanor pen in [her]276-eleanor hand . It 's awfully queer , [she]276-eleanor thought , touching the ink - corroded patch of bristle on the back of [Martin]205-martin 's walrus with the point of [her]276-eleanor pen , that THAT should have gone on all these years . That solid object might survive [them]1538-them all . If [she]276-eleanor threw it away it would still exist somewhere or other . But [she]276-eleanor never had thrown it away because it was part of other things - [[her]276-eleanor mother]685-her mother for example . . . . [She]276-eleanor drew on [her]276-eleanor blotting paper ; a dot with strokes raying out round it . Then [she]276-eleanor looked up . [They]1540-they were burning weeds in [the back garden]572-the back garden ; there was a drift of smoke ; a sharp acrid smell ; and leaves were falling . A barrel organ was playing up [the street]587-the street . " Sur le pont d'Avignon "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor hummed in time to it . How did it go ? - the song [Pippy]238-pippy used to sing as [she]238-pippy wiped [your]1543-your ears with a piece of slimy flannel ?

" [Ron]314-ronny , ron , [ron]5306-ron , et plon , plon plon , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor hummed . Then the tune stopped . The organ had moved further away . [She]276-eleanor dipped [her]276-eleanor pen in the ink .

" Three times eight , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor murmured , " is twenty - four , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said decidedly ; wrote a figure at the bottom of the page , swept together the little red and blue books and took them to [[[her]276-eleanor father]643-her father 's study]1545-her father 's study .

" Here 's [the housekeeper]5307-the housekeeper ! "[643-her father] [he]643-her father said good - humouredly as [she]276-eleanor came in . [He]643-her father was sitting in [his]643-her father leather armchair reading a pinkish financial paper .

" Here 's [the housekeeper]5307-the housekeeper , "[643-her father] [he]643-her father repeated , looking up over [his]643-her father glasses . [He]643-her father was getting slower and slower , [she]276-eleanor thought ; and [she]276-eleanor was in a hurry . But [they]1546-they got on extremely well ; [they]1546-they were almost like [brother]1547-brother and [sister]1548-sister . [He]643-her father put down [his]643-her father paper and went to the writing- table .

But [I]0-i wish [you]643-her father would hurry , [Papa]207-papa , [she]276-eleanor thought as [she]276-eleanor watched the deliberate way in which [he]643-her father unlocked the drawer in which [he]643-her father kept [his]643-her father cheque - book , or [I]0-i shall be late .

" Milk 's very high , "[643-her father] [he]643-her father said , tapping the book with the gilt cow . " Yes . It 's eggs in October , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said .

As [he]643-her father made out the cheque with extreme deliberation [she]276-eleanor glanced round [the room]577-the room . [It]577-the room looked like [an office]1550-an office , with [its]577-the room files of papers and [its]577-the room deed - boxes , except that horses ' bits hung by the fireplace , and there was the silver cup [he]643-her father had won at polo . Would [he]643-her father sit there all the morning reading the financial papers and considering [his]643-her father investments , [she]276-eleanor wondered ? [He]643-her father stopped writing .

" And where are [you]276-eleanor off to now ? "[643-her father] [he]643-her father asked with [his]643-her father shrewd little smile .

" A Committee , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said .

" A Committee , "[643-her father] [he]643-her father repeated , signing [his]643-her father firm heavy signature . " Well , stand up for [yourself]276-eleanor ; do n't be sat on , [Nell]276-eleanor . "[643-her father] [He]643-her father entered a figure in the ledger .

[Her]276-eleanor anger was rising ; it was [his]1655-him fault largely . [He]1655-him had swindled [her]276-eleanor . [A crowd of [children]569-children]1660-a crowd of children stood round staring at [Duffus]318-duffus 's pony . But [none of [them]1660-a crowd of children]1662-none of them , [she]276-eleanor noticed , dared stroke the pony 's nose .

[She]276-eleanor was late . [She]276-eleanor gave one look at the sunflower on the terra- cotta plaque . That symbol of [her]276-eleanor girlish sentiment amused [her]276-eleanor grimly . [She]276-eleanor had meant it to signify flowers , fields in [the heart of [London]1-london]1663-the heart of london ; but now it was cracked . [She]276-eleanor broke into [her]276-eleanor usual ambling trot . The movement seemed to break up the disagreeable crust ; to jolt off the grasp of [the old woman]1642-the old woman 's hand that was still on [her]1642-the old woman shoulder . [She]276-eleanor ran ; [she]276-eleanor dodged . [Shopping women]1665-shopping women got in [her]276-eleanor way . [She]276-eleanor dashed into [the road]705-the road waving [her]276-eleanor hand among [the carts]1667-the carts and horses . [The conductor]1668-the conductor saw [her]276-eleanor , curved [his]1668-the conductor arm round [her]276-eleanor and hauled [her]276-eleanor up . [She]276-eleanor had caught [[her]276-eleanor bus]1559-her bus .

[She]276-eleanor trod on the toe of [a man in the corner]1670-a man in the corner , and pitched down between [two elderly women]1671-two elderly women . [She]276-eleanor was panting slightly ; [her]276-eleanor hair was coming down ; [she]276-eleanor was red with running . [She]276-eleanor cast a glance at [[her]276-eleanor fellow - passengers]1672-her fellow - passengers . [The man on whose toe [she]276-eleanor had trodden]1688-the man on whose toe she had trodden sized [her]276-eleanor up ; [a well - known type]1689-a well - known type ; with a bag ; philanthropic ; well nourished ; [a spinster]1690-a spinster ; [a virgin]1691-a virgin ; like [all the women of [her]276-eleanor class]1692-all the women of her class , cold ; [her]276-eleanor passions had never been touched ; yet not unattractive . " There [he]237-morris is , "[334-celia] [Celia]334-celia whispered .

[One of [the barristers in the front row]1770-the barristers in the front row]1769-one of the barristers in the front row turned [his]1769-one of the barristers in the front row head . Nor did [she]276-eleanor smile at [him]237-morris ; the solemn sallow atmosphere forbade personalities ; there was something ceremonial about it all . From where [she]276-eleanor sat [she]276-eleanor could see [his]237-morris face in profile ; the wig squared [his]237-morris forehead , and gave [him]237-morris a framed look , like a picture . Never had [she]276-eleanor seen [him]237-morris to such advantage ; with such a brow , with such a nose . [She]276-eleanor glanced round . [They]1768-they all looked like pictures ; [all the barristers]1771-all the barristers looked emphatic , cut out , like eighteenth - century portraits hung upon a wall . [They]1768-they were still rising and settling , laughing , talking . . . . Suddenly a door was thrown open . [The usher]1772-the usher demanded silence for [[his]237-morris lordship]1773-his lordship . There was silence ; [everybody]547-everybody stood up ; and [the Judge]5327-the judge came in . [He]5327-the judge made one bow and took [his]5327-the judge seat under the Lion and the Unicorn . [Eleanor]276-eleanor felt a little thrill of awe run through [her]276-eleanor . That was [old Curry]239-old curry . But how transformed ! Last time [she]276-eleanor had seen [him]237-morris [he]237-morris was sitting at the head of a dinner - table ; a long yellow strip of embroidery went rippling down the middle ; and [he]237-morris had taken [her]276-eleanor , with a candle , round [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room to look at [[his]237-morris old oak]1777-his old oak . But now , there [he]237-morris was , awful , magisterial , in [his]237-morris robes .

[A barrister]1778-a barrister had risen . [She]276-eleanor tried to follow what [the man with a big nose]1779-the man with a big nose was saying ; but it was difficult to pick it up now . [She]276-eleanor listened , however . Then [another barrister]1780-another barrister rose - [a chicken - breasted little man , wearing gold pince - nez]1781-a chicken - breasted little man , wearing gold pince - nez . [He]1780-another barrister was reading some document ; then [he]1780-another barrister too began to argue . [She]276-eleanor could understand parts of what [he]1780-another barrister was saying ; though how it bore on the case [she]276-eleanor did not know . When was [Morris]237-morris going to speak , [she]276-eleanor wondered ? Not yet apparently . As [[her]276-eleanor father]643-her father had said , [these lawyer chaps]5326-these lawyer chaps knew how to spin things out . There had been no need to hurry over luncheon ; [an omnibus]1674-an omnibus would have done just as well . [She]276-eleanor fixed [her]276-eleanor eyes on [Morris]237-morris . [He]237-morris was cracking some joke with [the sandy man next to [him]237-morris]1785-the sandy man next to him . Those were [[his]237-morris cronies]1786-his cronies , [she]276-eleanor thought ; this was [his]237-morris life . [She]276-eleanor remembered [his]237-morris passion for [the Bar]862-the bar as [a boy]1788-a boy . It was [she]276-eleanor who had talked [Papa]207-papa round ; one morning [she]276-eleanor had taken [her]276-eleanor life in [her]276-eleanor hand and gone to [[his]207-papa study]1789-his study . . . but now , to [her]276-eleanor excitement , [Morris]237-morris [himself]237-morris got up .

[She]276-eleanor felt [[her]276-eleanor sister - in - law]1790-her sister - in - law stiffen with nervousness and clasp [her]276-eleanor little bag tightly . [Morris]237-morris looked very tall , and very black and white as [he]237-morris began . One hand was on the edge of [his]237-morris gown . How well [she]276-eleanor knew that gesture of [Morris]237-morris 's , [she]276-eleanor thought - grasping something , so that [you]1791-you saw the white scar where [he]237-morris had cut [himself]237-morris bathing . But [she]276-eleanor did not recognise the other gesture - the way [he]237-morris flung [his]237-morris arm out . That belonged to [his]237-morris public life , [his]237-morris life in [the Courts]865-the courts . And [his]237-morris voice was unfamiliar . But every now and then as [he]237-morris warmed to [his]237-morris speech , there was a tone in [his]237-morris voice that made [her]276-eleanor smile ; it was [his]237-morris private voice . [She]276-eleanor could not help half turning to [[her]276-eleanor sister - in - law]1790-her sister - in - law as if to say , How like [Morris]237-morris ! But [Celia]334-celia was looking with absolute fixity ahead of [her]334-celia at [[her]334-celia husband]1135-her husband . [Eleanor]276-eleanor , too , tried to fix [her]276-eleanor mind upon the argument . [He]237-morris spoke with extraordinary clearness ; [he]237-morris spaced [his]237-morris words beautifully . Suddenly [the Judge]5327-the judge interrupted :

" Do [I]237-morris understand [you]276-eleanor to hold , [Mr Pargiter]337-mr pargiter . . . ? "[237-morris] [he]237-morris said in urbane yet awful tones ; and [Eleanor]276-eleanor was thrilled to see how instantly [Morris]237-morris stopped short ; how respectfully [he]237-morris bent [his]237-morris head as [the Judge]5327-the judge spoke .

But will [he]237-morris know the answer ? [she]276-eleanor thought , as if [he]237-morris were [a child]1713-a child , shifting in [her]276-eleanor seat with nervousness lest [he]237-morris might break down . But [he]237-morris had the answer at [his]237-morris finger - ends . Without hurry or flutter [he]237-morris opened a book ; found [his]237-morris place ; read out a passage , upon which [old Curry]239-old curry nodded , and made a note in the great volume that lay open in front of [him]237-morris . [She]276-eleanor was immensely relieved .

" How well [he]237-morris did that ! "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor whispered . [[Her]276-eleanor sister - in - law]1790-her sister - in - law nodded ; but [she]1790-her sister - in - law still grasped [her]1790-her sister - in - law bag tightly . [Eleanor]276-eleanor felt that [she]276-eleanor could relax . [She]276-eleanor glanced round [her]276-eleanor . It was an odd mixture of solemnity and licence . [Barristers]1799-barristers kept coming in and out . [They]1799-barristers stood leaning against the wall of [the Court]1765-the court . [She]276-eleanor gazed at [the Judge]5327-the judge [himself]5327-the judge . [He]5327-the judge was now lying back in [his]5327-the judge great carved chair under the Lion and [the Unicorn]338-the unicorn , listening . [He]5327-the judge looked infinitely sad and wise , as if words had been beating upon [him]5327-the judge for centuries . Now [he]5327-the judge opened [his]5327-the judge heavy eyes , wrinkled [his]5327-the judge forehead , and [the little hand that emerged frailly from the enormous cuff]1802-the little hand that emerged frailly from the enormous cuff wrote a few words in the great volume . Then again [he]5327-the judge lapsed with half - shut eyes into [his]5327-the judge eternal vigil over the strife of [unhappy human beings]1803-unhappy human beings . [Her]276-eleanor mind wandered . [She]276-eleanor leant back against the hard wooden seat and let the tide of oblivion flow over [her]276-eleanor . [She]276-eleanor fidgeted . " This [I]5327-the judge picked up at [Whitby]69-whitby , "[5327-the judge] [he]5327-the judge had said . And it was a sham . [She]276-eleanor wanted to laugh ; [she]276-eleanor wanted to move . [She]276-eleanor rose and whispered :

" [I]276-eleanor 'm going . "[276-eleanor]

[[Her]276-eleanor sister - in - law]1790-her sister - in - law made a little murmur , perhaps of protest . But [Eleanor]276-eleanor made [her]276-eleanor way as silently as [she]276-eleanor could through the swing doors , out into [the street]587-the street .

The uproar , the confusion , the space of [the Strand]1813-the strand came upon [her]276-eleanor with a shock of relief . [She]276-eleanor felt [herself]276-eleanor expand . It was still daylight [here]5159-here ; a rush , a stir , a turmoil of variegated life came racing towards [her]276-eleanor . It was as if something had broken loose - in [her]276-eleanor , in [the world]5285-the world . [She]276-eleanor seemed , after [her]276-eleanor concentration , to be dissipated , tossed about . Above was the dazzle of a watery but gleaming sky . The wind blew in [her]276-eleanor face . [She]276-eleanor breathed in a gulp of fresh wet air . And [that man]1368-that man , [she]276-eleanor thought , thinking of [the dark little Court]1821-the dark little court and [its]1821-the dark little court cut - out faces , has to sit there all day , every day . [She]276-eleanor saw [Sanders Curry]239-old curry again , lying back in [his]239-old curry great chair , with [his]239-old curry face falling in folds of iron . Every day , all day , [she]276-eleanor thought , arguing points of law . How could [Morris]237-morris stand it ? But [he]237-morris had always wanted to go to [the Bar]862-the bar .

[Cabs]1562-cabs , [vans and omnibuses]1824-vans and omnibuses streamed past ; [they]1824-vans and omnibuses seemed to rush the air into [her]276-eleanor face ; they splashed the mud onto the pavement . [She]276-eleanor was stopped by [a van]1826-a van turning down one of [the little steep streets that led to [the river]813-the river]1827-the little steep streets that led to the river . [She]276-eleanor looked up and saw the clouds moving between the roofs , dark clouds , rain - swollen ; wandering , indifferent clouds . [She]276-eleanor walked on .

Again [she]276-eleanor was stopped at [the entrance to [Charing Cross station]1830-charing cross station]1829-the entrance to charing cross station . The sky was wide at that point . [She]276-eleanor saw a file of birds flying high , flying together ; crossing the sky . [She]276-eleanor watched [them]1824-vans and omnibuses . Again [she]276-eleanor walked on . [She]276-eleanor envied [them]1562-cabs . [She]276-eleanor wished [she]276-eleanor were going abroad ; to [Italy]70-italy , to [India]13-india . . . . [Men]1412-men were snatching them and opening them and reading [them]1412-men as [they]1412-men walked on . [She]276-eleanor looked at a placard that was crumpled across [a boy]1788-a boy 's legs . " Death "[276-eleanor] was written in very large black letters .

Then the placard blew straight , and [she]276-eleanor read another word : " [Parnell]223-parnell . "[276-eleanor]

" Dead "[276-eleanor] . . . [she]276-eleanor repeated . " [Parnell]223-parnell . "[276-eleanor] [She]276-eleanor was dazed for a moment . How could [he]1788-a boy be dead - [Parnell]223-parnell ? [She]276-eleanor bought a paper . [They]1838-they said so . . . .

It was like something fading in the sky .

[She]276-eleanor walked slowly along towards [Trafalgar Square]71-trafalgar square , holding the paper in [her]276-eleanor hand . Suddenly the whole scene froze into immobility . [A man]814-a man was joined to a pillar ; a lion was joined to [a man]814-a man ; they seemed stilled , connected , as if they would never move again .

[She]276-eleanor crossed into [Trafalgar Square]71-trafalgar square . Birds chattered shrilly somewhere . [She]276-eleanor stopped by the fountain and looked down into [the large basin full of water]1843-the large basin full of water . The water rippled black as the wind ruffled it . There were reflections in the water , branches and a pale strip of sky . What a dream , [she]276-eleanor murmured ; what a dream . . . But [someone]591-someone jostled [her]276-eleanor . [She]276-eleanor must go to [her]201-delia . This would be the end of all [her]276-eleanor dreams . [She]276-eleanor turned and hailed [a cab]914-a cab .

[She]276-eleanor leant over the flaps of [the cab]708-the cab looking out . [The streets]1492-the streets [they]1851-they were driving through were horribly poor ; and not only poor , [she]276-eleanor thought , but vicious . Here was the vice , the obscenity , the reality of [London]1-london . It was lurid in the mixed evening light . Lamps were being lit . [Paper - boys]1852-paper - boys were crying , [Parnell]223-parnell . . . [Parnell]223-parnell . The sound of the traffic was dulled . It was very silent here . In the October afternoon , with dead leaves falling , [the old faded Square]1858-the old faded square looked dingy and decrepit and full of mist . [The houses]1569-the houses were let out in [offices]1860-offices , to [societies]1861-societies , to [people whose names were pinned up on the door - posts]1862-people whose names were pinned up on the door - posts . [Her]276-eleanor card was fixed by a drawing- pin to a panel . [She]276-eleanor knocked and waited . There was no sound . [She]276-eleanor turned the handle . The door was locked . [She]276-eleanor stood for a moment listening . A little window at the side gave on to [the square]1857-the square . Pigeons crooned on the tree - tops . The traffic hummed far off ; [she]276-eleanor could just hear paperboys crying death . . . death . . . death . The leaves were falling . [She]276-eleanor turned and went [downstairs]969-downstairs .

[She]276-eleanor strolled along [the streets]1492-the streets . "[276-eleanor] [She]276-eleanor guessed at the life that went on behind those thick yellow curtains . Here the door opened , and as [he]342-antonio went [upstairs]684-upstairs [he]342-antonio thought [he]342-antonio heard , from somewhere in the background , a shout of laughter .

[He]342-antonio liked [[Eugénie]225-eugénie 's drawing - room]1927-eugénie 's drawing - room , [he]342-antonio thought , as [he]342-antonio stood there waiting . It was very untidy . [He]342-antonio straightened [his]342-antonio tie in front of it .

But [I]0-i prefer a glass in which [one]847-one can see [oneself]847-one , [he]342-antonio thought , turning away . There was the piano open ; and the tea - [he]342-antonio smiled - with the cup half full as usual ; and branches stuck about [the room]577-the room , branches of withering red and yellow leaves . [She]225-eugénie liked flowers . [He]342-antonio was glad [he]342-antonio had remembered to bring [her]225-eugénie [his]342-antonio usual gift . [He]342-antonio held the flower wrapped in tissue paper in front of [him]342-antonio . But why was [the room]577-the room so full of smoke ? A gust blew in . Both windows in [the back room]724-the back room were open , and the smoke was blowing in from [the garden]5163-the garden . Were they burning weeds , [he]342-antonio wondered ? [He]342-antonio walked to the window and looked out . Yes , there [they]1934-they were - [Eugénie]225-eugénie and [the two little girls]1923-the two little girls . There was a bonfire . [She]225-eugénie jerked [them]1934-they as high as [she]225-eugénie could , and the fire blazed up . A great fan of red flame flung out .

" That 's dangerous ! "[342-antonio] [he]342-antonio called out .

[Eugénie]225-eugénie pulled [the children]555-the children back . [They]555-the children were dancing with excitement . [The other little girl]1938-the other little girl , [Sara]344-sara , ducked under [[her]1938-the other little girl mother]685-her mother 's arm , seized another armful of leaves and flung them again . [Eugénie]225-eugénie turned and saw [him]342-antonio . [She]225-eugénie held [the children]555-the children back with one hand and raised the other in welcome .
