"[344-sara] [She]344-sara looked at [[her]344-sara sister]615-her sister as if [they]3839-they both remembered the same thing .

" A waltz . . . "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor . [Sara]344-sara was drumming a waltz rhythm on the table . [Eleanor]276-eleanor began to hum in time to it : " Hoity te , toity te , hoity te . . . . "[276-eleanor]

A long - drawn hollow sound wailed out .

" No , no ! "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor protested , as if [somebody]579-somebody had given [her]276-eleanor the wrong note . But the sound wailed again .

" A fog - horn ? "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said . " On [the river]813-the river ? "[276-eleanor]

" [The Germans]437-the germans ! "[389-renny] said [Renny]389-renny . " [Those damned Germans]5816-those damned germans ! "[389-renny] [He]389-renny put down [his]389-renny knife and fork with an exaggerated gesture of boredom .

" [The Germans]437-the germans . . . "[276-eleanor] said [Eleanor]276-eleanor as the door shut . [She]276-eleanor felt as if [some dull bore]3842-some dull bore had interrupted an interesting conversation . The colours began to fade . [She]276-eleanor had been looking at the red chair . [They]3843-they heard the rush of wheels in [the street]587-the street . Everything seemed to be going past very quickly . There was the round of feet tapping on [the pavement]570-the pavement . [Eleanor]276-eleanor got up and drew the curtains slightly apart . [The basement]521-the basement was sunk beneath [the pavement]570-the pavement , so that [she]276-eleanor only saw [people]503-people 's legs and skirts as [they]503-people went past the area railings . " [The children]555-the children . . . "[344-sara] said [Sara]344-sara . [They]1417-the houses opposite heard the dull boom of a gun in the distance .

With [its]3855-the cellar crypt - like ceiling and stone walls [it]3855-the cellar had a damp ecclesiastical look . [It]3855-the cellar was used partly for coal , partly for wine . The light in the centre shone on glittering heaps of coal ; bottles of wine wrapped in straw lay on their sides on stone shelves . There was a mouldy smell of wine , straw and damp . [He]389-renny seemed to have released something in [her]276-eleanor ; [she]276-eleanor felt not only a new space of time , but new powers , something unknown within [her]276-eleanor . [We]3899-we shall be free , [we]3899-we shall be free , [Eleanor]276-eleanor thought .

" And what have [you]344-sara been thinking all this time ? "[431-nicholas] said [Nicholas]431-nicholas , laying [his]431-nicholas hand on [Sara]344-sara 's knee . [She]276-eleanor started . " Or have [you]344-sara been asleep ? "[431-nicholas] [he]431-nicholas added .

" [I]276-eleanor heard what [you]431-nicholas were saying , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said .

" What were [we]3899-we saying ? "[431-nicholas] [he]431-nicholas asked .

" Not such a bad shot , "[431-nicholas] said [Nicholas]431-nicholas .

" Because [people]503-people always say the same thing , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor laughed . [She]276-eleanor roused [herself]276-eleanor and sat up . ' "[276-eleanor]

" Because [he]431-nicholas loves , "[344-sara] [Sara]344-sara explained . [She]344-sara paused . " - the other sex , the other sex , [you]276-eleanor see , "[344-sara] [she]344-sara said lightly , waving [her]344-sara hand in the way that was so like [[her]276-eleanor mother]685-her mother 's .

The sharp shiver passed . [Underneath]441-underneath was - what ? [She]276-eleanor looked at [Nicholas]431-nicholas . [He]431-nicholas was watching [her]276-eleanor .

" Not in the least , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said again . [He]431-nicholas gave [her]276-eleanor a little bow . [She]276-eleanor returned it with a little bow . All [the houses]1569-the houses were still curtained . The cold winter 's night was almost black . It was like looking into the hollow of a dark - blue stone . A happy marriage . [She]276-eleanor looked up as [she]276-eleanor walked down [the dark little street]3911-the dark little street behind [the others]535-the others . It seemed to take what [she]276-eleanor was feeling and to express it broadly and simply , as if another voice were speaking in another language . Then the light stopped and examined a fleecy patch of sky , a suspected spot .

The raid ! [she]276-eleanor said to [herself]276-eleanor . [I]0-i 'd forgotten the raid !

1918

A veil of mist covered the November sky ; a many folded veil , so fine - meshed that it made one density . It was not raining , but here and there the mist condensed on the surface into dampness and made pavements greasy . Here and there on a grass blade or on a hedge leaf a drop hung motionless . It was windless and calm . Sounds coming through the veil - the bleat of sheep , the croak of [rooks]3925-rooks - were deadened . The uproar of the traffic merged into one growl . Now and then as if a door opened and shut , or the veil parted and closed , the roar boomed and faded .

" [Dirty brute]5855-dirty brute , "[202-crosby] [Crosby]202-crosby muttered as [she]202-crosby hobbled along [the asphalt path]3926-the asphalt path across [Richmond Green]131-richmond green . [Her]202-crosby legs were paining [her]202-crosby . It was not actually raining , but [the great open space]3927-the great open space was full of mist ; and there was [nobody near]3928-nobody near , so that [she]202-crosby could talk aloud .

" [Dirty brute]5855-dirty brute , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby muttered again . [She]202-crosby had got into the habit of talking aloud . There was [nobody in sight]3929-nobody in sight ; the end of [the path]1232-the path was lost in mist . It was very silent . Only [the rooks]3931-the rooks gathered on the tree tops now and then let fall a queer little croak , and a leaf , spotted with black , fell to the ground . [Her]202-crosby face twitched as [she]202-crosby walked , as if [her]202-crosby muscles had got into the habit of protesting , involuntarily , against the spites and obstacles that tormented [her]202-crosby . [She]202-crosby had aged greatly during the past four years . [She]202-crosby looked so small and hunched that it seemed doubtful if [she]202-crosby could make [her]202-crosby way across [the wide open space]3932-the wide open space , shrouded in white mist . But [she]202-crosby had to go to [the High Street]3933-the high street to do [her]202-crosby shopping .

" [The dirty brute]5857-the dirty brute , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby muttered again . [She]202-crosby had had some words that morning with [Mrs Burt]396-mrs burt about [[the Count]3934-the count 's bath]3935-the count 's bath . [He]3934-the count spat in it , and [Mrs Burt]396-mrs burt had told [her]202-crosby to clean it .

" [Count]442-count indeed - [he]442-count 's no more Count than [you]396-mrs burt are , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby continued . [She]202-crosby was talking to [Mrs Burt]396-mrs burt now . " [I]202-crosby 'm quite willing to oblige [you]396-mrs burt , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby went on . Even out here , in [the mist]3936-the mist , where [she]202-crosby was free to say what [she]202-crosby liked , [she]202-crosby adopted a conciliatory tone , because [she]202-crosby knew that [they]3937-they wanted to be rid of [her]202-crosby . [She]202-crosby gesticulated with the hand that was not carrying the bag as [she]202-crosby told [Louisa]199-louisa that [she]202-crosby was quite ready to oblige [her]199-louisa . [She]202-crosby hobbled on . " And [I]202-crosby should n't mind going either , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby added bitterly , but this was spoken to [herself]202-crosby only . It was no pleasure to [her]202-crosby to live in [the house]554-the house any more ; but there was nowhere else for [her]202-crosby to go ; that [the Burts]443-the burts knew very well .

" And [I]202-crosby 'm quite ready to oblige [you]199-louisa , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby added aloud , as indeed [she]202-crosby had said to [Louisa]199-louisa [herself]199-louisa . But the truth was that [she]202-crosby was no longer able to work as [she]202-crosby had done . [Her]202-crosby legs pained [her]202-crosby . It took all the strength out of [her]202-crosby to do [her]202-crosby own shopping , let alone to clean [the bath]3939-the bath . But it was all take - it - or - leave - it now . In the old days [she]202-crosby would have sent [the whole lot]3940-the whole lot packing .

" [Drabs . . . hussies]5858-drabs . . . hussies , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby muttered . [She]202-crosby was now addressing [the red - haired servant girl who had flung out of [the house]554-the house yesterday without warning]3941-the red - haired servant girl who had flung out of the house yesterday without warning . [SHE]202-crosby could easily get another job . It did n't matter to [her]202-crosby . So it was left to [Crosby]202-crosby to clean [[the Count]3934-the count 's bath]3935-the count 's bath .

" [Dirty brute]5855-dirty brute , [dirty brute]5855-dirty brute , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby repeated ; [her]202-crosby pale - blue eyes glared impotently . [She]202-crosby saw once more the blob of spittle that [the Count]3934-the count had left on the side of [[his]3934-the count bath]3946-his bath - [the Belgian who called [himself]3934-the count [a Count]3948-a count]3947-the belgian who called himself a count . " [I]202-crosby 've been used to work for [gentlefolk]5861-gentlefolk , not for [dirty foreigners like [you]3949-you]5862-dirty foreigners like you , "[202-crosby] [she]202-crosby told [him]3949-you as [she]202-crosby hobbled .

The roar of traffic sounded louder as [she]202-crosby approached the ghostly line of trees . [She]202-crosby could see [houses]1311-houses now beyond the trees . [Her]202-crosby pale - blue eyes peered forward through the mist as [she]202-crosby made [her]202-crosby way towards the railings . [Her]202-crosby eyes alone seemed to express an unconquerable determination ; [she]202-crosby was not going to give in ; [she]202-crosby was bent on surviving . The soft mist was slowly lifting . Leaves lay damp and purple on [the asphalt path]3926-the asphalt path . [The rooks]3931-the rooks croaked and shuffled on the tree tops . Now a dark line of railings emerged from the mist . The roar of traffic in [the High Street]3933-the high street sounded louder and louder . [Crosby]202-crosby stopped and rested [her]202-crosby bag on the railing before [she]202-crosby went on to do battle with [the crowd of shoppers in [the High Street]3933-the high street]3954-the crowd of shoppers in the high street . [She]202-crosby would have to shove and push , and be jostled this way and that ; and [her]202-crosby feet pained [her]202-crosby . [They]3956-they did n't mind if [you]3957-you bought or not , [she]202-crosby thought ; and often [she]202-crosby was pushed out of [her]202-crosby place by [some bold - faced drab]3958-some bold - faced drab . [She]202-crosby thought of [the red- haired girl]3959-the red- haired girl again , as [she]202-crosby stood there , panting slightly , with [her]202-crosby bag on the railing . [Her]202-crosby legs pained [her]202-crosby . Suddenly the long - drawn note of a siren floated out its melancholy wail of sound ; then there was a dull explosion .

" Them guns again , "[202-crosby] [Crosby]202-crosby muttered , looking up at the pale - grey sky with peevish irritation . [The rooks , scared by the gun - fire]3960-the rooks , scared by the gun - fire , rose and wheeled round [the tree tops]3961-the tree tops . Then there was another dull boom . [A man on a ladder]3962-a man on a ladder who was painting the windows of [one of [the houses]1569-the houses]2092-one of the houses paused with [his]3962-a man on a ladder brush in [his]3962-a man on a ladder hand and looked round . [A woman who was walking along carrying a loaf of bread that stuck half out of its paper wrapping]3965-a woman who was walking along carrying a loaf of bread that stuck half out of its paper wrapping stopped too . [They]3966-they both waited as if for something to happen . A topple of smoke drifted over and flopped down from the chimneys . The guns boomed again . [The man on the ladder]3967-the man on the ladder said something to [the woman on the pavement]3968-the woman on the pavement . [She]3968-the woman on the pavement nodded [her]3968-the woman on the pavement head . Then [he]3967-the man on the ladder dipped [his]3967-the man on the ladder brush in the pot and went on painting . [The woman]5500-the woman walked on . [Crosby]202-crosby pulled [herself]202-crosby together and tottered across [the road]705-the road into [the High Street]3933-the high street . The guns went on booming and the sirens wailed . The war was over - so [somebody]579-somebody told [her]202-crosby as [she]202-crosby took [her]202-crosby place in the queue at [[the grocer]782-the grocer 's shop]3974-the grocer 's shop . The guns went on booming and the sirens wailed .

PRESENT DAY

It was a summer evening ; the sun was setting ; the sky was blue still , but tinged with gold , as if a thin veil of gauze hung over it , and here and there in the gold - blue amplitude [an island of cloud]3975-an island of cloud lay suspended . In [the fields]502-the fields the trees stood majestically caparisoned , with their innumerable leaves gilt . Sheep and cows , pearl white and parti - coloured , lay recumbent or munched [their]3977-their way through the half transparent grass . An edge of light surrounded everything . A red - gold fume rose from the dust on [the roads]3779-the roads . Even [the little red brick villas on [the high roads]3980-the high roads]3979-the little red brick villas on the high roads had become porous , incandescent with light , and the flowers in [cottage gardens]3981-cottage gardens , lilac and pink like cotton dresses , shone veined as if lit from within . Faces of [people standing at cottage doors or padding along [pavements]3983-pavements]3982-people standing at cottage doors or padding along pavements showed the same red glow as [they]3982-people standing at cottage doors or padding along pavements fronted the slowly sinking sun .

[Eleanor]276-eleanor came out of [[her]276-eleanor flat]3984-her flat and shut the door . [Her]276-eleanor face was lit up by the glow of the sun as it sank over [London]1-london , and for a moment [she]276-eleanor was dazzled and looked out over the roofs and spires that lay beneath . There were [people]503-people talking inside [[her]276-eleanor room]2890-her room , and [she]276-eleanor wanted to have a word with [[her]276-eleanor nephew]2774-her nephew alone . [North]383-north , [[her]276-eleanor brother]1106-her brother [[Morris]237-morris 's son]5794-morris 's son , had just come back from [Africa]14-africa , and [she]276-eleanor had scarcely seen [him]383-north alone . [So many people]3106-so many people had dropped in that evening - [Miriam Parrish]195-mira ; [Ralph Pickersgill]444-ralph pickersgill ; [Antony Wedd]445-antony wedd ; [[her]276-eleanor niece]2775-her niece [Peggy]316-maggie , and on top of [them]3106-so many people all , [that very talkative man]3992-that very talkative man , [[her]276-eleanor friend]1242-her friend [Nicholas Pomjalovsky]431-nicholas , whom [they]3106-so many people called [Brown]446-brown for short . [She]276-eleanor had scarcely had a word with [North]383-north alone . For a moment [they]3106-so many people stood in the bright square of sunshine that fell on the stone floor of [the passage]738-the passage . Voices were still talking within . [She]276-eleanor put [her]276-eleanor hand on [his]383-north shoulder .

" It 's so nice to see [you]383-north , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said . " And [you]383-north have n't changed . . . "[276-eleanor] [She]276-eleanor looked at [him]383-north . [She]276-eleanor still saw traces of [the brown - eyed cricketing boy in [the massive man , who was so burnt , and a little grey too over the ears]3996-the massive man , who was so burnt , and a little grey too over the ears]3995-the brown - eyed cricketing boy in the massive man , who was so burnt , and a little grey too over the ears . " [We]3106-so many people sha'n't let [you]383-north go back , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor continued , beginning to walk [downstairs]969-downstairs with [him]383-north , " to [that horrid farm]5863-that horrid farm . "[276-eleanor]

[He]383-north smiled . " And [you]276-eleanor have n't changed either , "[383-north] [he]383-north said .

[She]276-eleanor looked very vigorous . [She]276-eleanor had been in [India]13-india . [Her]276-eleanor face was tanned with the sun . With [her]276-eleanor white hair and [her]276-eleanor brown cheeks [she]276-eleanor scarcely looked [her]276-eleanor age , but [she]276-eleanor must be well over seventy , [he]383-north was thinking . [They]3998-they walked [downstairs]969-downstairs arm - in - arm . There were six flights of stone steps to descend , but [she]276-eleanor insisted upon coming all the way down with [him]383-north , to see [him]383-north off .

" And North , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , when [they]3998-they reached [the hall]638-the hall , " [you]383-north will be careful . . . . "[276-eleanor] [She]276-eleanor stopped on the doorstep . " Driving in [London]1-london , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , " is n't the same as driving in [Africa]14-africa . "[276-eleanor]

There was [[his]383-north little sports car]4001-his little sports car outside ; [a man]814-a man was going past the door in the evening sunlight crying " Old chairs and baskets to mend . "[814-a man]

[He]383-north shook [his]383-north head ; [his]383-north voice was drowned by the voice of [the man]826-the man crying . [He]383-north glanced at a board that hung in [the hall]638-the hall with names on it . Who was in and who was out was signified with a care that amused [him]383-north slightly , after [Africa]14-africa . The voice of [the man]826-the man crying " Old chairs and baskets to mend , "[826-the man] slowly died away .

" Well , good - bye , [Eleanor]276-eleanor , "[383-north] [he]383-north said turning . " [We]5864-we shall meet later . "[383-north] [He]383-north got into [[his]383-north car]4006-his car .

" Oh , but [North]383-north - "[4007-she] [she]4007-she cried , suddenly remembering something [she]4007-she wanted to say to [him]383-north . But [he]383-north had turned on the engine ; [he]383-north did not hear [her]4007-she voice . [He]383-north waved [his]383-north hand to [her]4007-she - there [she]4007-she stood at the top of the steps with [her]4007-she hair blowing in the wind . [The car]2512-the car started off with a jerk . [She]4007-she gave another wave of [her]4007-she hand to [him]383-north as [he]383-north turned the corner .

[Eleanor]276-eleanor is just the same , [he]383-north thought : more erratic perhaps . With [a room full of [people]503-people]4009-a room full of people - [[her]4007-she little room]2976-her little room had been crowded - [she]4007-she had insisted upon showing [him]383-north [her]4007-she new shower - bath . " [You]383-north press that knob , "[4007-she] [she]4007-she had said , " and look - "[4007-she] Innumerable needles of water shot down . [He]383-north laughed aloud . [They]4012-they had sat on the edge of [the bath]3939-the bath together .

But [the cars]3394-the cars behind [him]383-north hooted persistently ; [they]3394-the cars hooted and hooted . What at ? [he]383-north asked . Suddenly [he]383-north realised that [they]3394-the cars were hooting at [him]383-north . The light had changed ; it was green now , [he]383-north had been blocking the way . [He]383-north started off with a violent jerk . [He]383-north had not mastered the art of driving in [London]1-london .

The noise of [London]1-london still seemed to [him]383-north deafening , and the speed at which [people]503-people drove was terrifying . But it was exciting after [Africa]14-africa . [The shops]1428-the shops even , [he]383-north thought , as [he]383-north shot past rows of plate- glass windows , were marvellous . Along [the kerb]2032-the kerb , too , there were barrows of fruit and flowers . Everywhere there was profusion ; plenty . . . . Again the red light shone out ; [he]383-north pulled up .

[He]383-north looked about [him]383-north . [He]383-north was somewhere in [Oxford Street]67-oxford street ; [the pavement]570-the pavement was crowded with [people]503-people ; jostling [each other]996-each other ; swarming round the plate - glass windows which were still lit up . The gaiety , the colour , the variety , were amazing after [Africa]14-africa . All these years , [he]383-north thought to [himself]383-north , looking at a floating banner of transparent silk , [he]383-north had been used to raw goods ; hides and fleeces ; here was the finished article . A dressing - case , of yellow leather fitted with silver bottles , caught [his]383-north eye . But the light was green again . On [he]383-north jerked .

[He]383-north had only been back ten days , and [his]383-north mind was a jumble of odds and ends . It seemed to [him]383-north that [he]383-north had never stopped talking : shaking hands ; saying How - d'you - do ? [People]503-people sprang up everywhere ; [[his]383-north father]639-his father ; [[his]383-north sister]1119-his sister ; [old men]4024-old men got up from armchairs and said , [You]4025-you do n't remember [me]0-i ? [He]383-north was still confused by it all ; [they]503-people talked so fast ; [they]503-people must think [him]383-north very slow , [he]383-north thought . [He]383-north had to withdraw into the window and say , " What , what , what do [they]503-people mean by it ? "[383-north]

[He]4119-he strolled to the window . The sun must be setting , for the brick of [the house]554-the house at the corner blushed a yellowish pink . One or two high windows were burnished gold . [The girl]1220-the girl was in [the room]577-the room , and [she]1220-the girl distracted [him]4119-he ; also the noise of [London]1-london still bothered [him]4119-he . Against the dull background of traffic noises , of wheels turning and brakes squeaking , there rose near at hand the cry of [a woman]5302-a woman suddenly alarmed for [[her]5302-a woman child]4131-her child ; the monotonous cry of [a man selling vegetables]4132-a man selling vegetables ; and far away a barrel organ was playing . It stopped ; it began again . [I]0-i used to write to [her]1220-the girl , [he]4119-he thought , late at night , when [I]0-i felt lonely , when [I]0-i was young . [He]4119-he looked at [himself]4119-he in the glass . [He]4119-he saw [his]4119-he sunburnt face with the broad cheek bones and the little brown eyes .

[The girl]1220-the girl had been sucked down into [the lower portion of [the house]554-the house]4134-the lower portion of the house . The door stood open . Nothing seemed to be happening . [He]4119-he waited . [He]4119-he felt [an outsider]4136-an outsider . After all these years , [he]4119-he thought , [everyone]863-everyone was paired off ; settled down ; busy with [their]863-everyone own affairs . [You]4138-you found [them]863-everyone telephoning , remembering other conversations ; [they]863-everyone went out of [the room]577-the room ; [they]863-everyone left [one]847-one alone . [He]4119-he took up a book and read a sentence .

" [A shadow like an angel with bright hair . . . "[4119-he]

[She]316-maggie was alone with [Eleanor]276-eleanor in [the cab]708-the cab . And [they]4272-they were passing [houses]1311-houses . Where does [she]316-maggie begin , and where do [I]0-i end ? [The house]554-the house was quiet now , save for the sound of the bath water running away . A watery pattern fluctuated on the ceiling . " Hacket ? [Hacket]459-hacket ? "[4437-the handsome old irishman] [he]4437-the handsome old irishman repeated . [She]0-i smiled . The steps from brain to brain must be cut very shallow , if thought is to mount them , [she]0-i noted .

"[4437-the handsome old irishman] It seemed that there were Hackets in [Galway]176-galway , and the mistake , which [she]0-i did not trouble to explain , was all to the good , for it set [him]4437-the handsome old irishman off , and [he]4437-the handsome old irishman told [her]0-i stories about [the Hackets]460-the hackets as [they]4438-them sat side by side on the sofa .

[A grown woman]4440-a grown woman , [she]0-i thought , crosses [London]1-london to talk to [a deaf old man]4441-a deaf old man about the Hackets , whom [she]0-i 's never heard of , when [she]0-i meant to ask after [the gardener who cut [his]4437-the handsome old irishman [toe off with a hatchet]4443-toe off with a hatchet]4442-the gardener who cut his toe off with a hatchet . But does it matter ? Hackets or hatchets ? [She]0-i laughed , happily in time with a joke , so that it seemed appropriate . But [one]847-one wants [somebody]579-somebody to laugh with , [she]0-i thought . Pleasure is increased by sharing it . Does the same hold good of pain ? [she]0-i mused . Is that the reason why [we]4446-we all talk so much of ill - health - because sharing things lessens things ? [He]383-north looked round for an excuse to go .

One little book , and then another little book - [Peggy]316-maggie 's taunt returned to [him]383-north . The words had stung [him]383-north out of all proportion to their surface meaning . [She]316-maggie had turned on [him]383-north with such violence , as if [she]316-maggie despised [him]383-north ; [she]316-maggie had looked as if [she]316-maggie were going to burst into tears . [He]383-north opened the little book . Latin , was it ? [He]383-north broke off a sentence and let it swim in [his]383-north mind . There the words lay , beautiful , yet meaningless , yet composed in a pattern - nox est perpetua una dormienda . [He]383-north remembered [[his]383-north master]4802-his master saying , Mark the long word at the end of the sentence . There the words floated ; but just as [they]4803-they were about to give out their meaning , there was a movement at the door . [Old Patrick]474-patrick had come ambling up , had given [his]474-patrick arm gallantly to [the widow of [the Governor - General]4805-the governor - general]4804-the widow of the governor - general , and [they]4806-they were proceeding with a curious air of antiquated ceremony down [the stairs]573-the stairs . Why had [the poor old boy]4879-the poor old boy been brought over [here]5159-here , [North]383-north wondered , and stuck into those tight shoes ? [He]474-patrick was clearly talking to [his]474-patrick dogs . There was a look in [his]474-patrick eyes now when [he]474-patrick raised them again and tried to recover the drift of what [he]474-patrick had been saying that was like the look of a sportsman who saw the birds rising in a semicircle over [the wide green bog]4881-the wide green bog . But [they]4882-they were out of shot . [He]474-patrick could not remember where [he]474-patrick had got to . " . . . [We]6291-we talk things over , "[474-patrick] [he]474-patrick said , " round a table . "[474-patrick] [His]474-patrick eyes became mild and vacant as if the engine were cut off , and [his]474-patrick mind glided on silently .

" The English talk too , "[383-north] said [North]383-north perfunctorily . [Patrick]474-patrick nodded , and looked vaguely at [a group of [young people]4240-young people]4883-a group of young people . But [he]474-patrick was not interested in what [other people]617-other people were saying . [His]474-patrick mind could no longer stretch beyond its beat . [His]474-patrick body was still beautifully proportioned ; it was [his]474-patrick mind that was old . [He]474-patrick would say the same thing all over again , and when [he]474-patrick had said it [he]474-patrick would pick [his]474-patrick teeth and sit gazing in front of [him]474-patrick . There [he]474-patrick sat now , holding a flower between [his]474-patrick finger and thumb , loosely , without looking at it , as if [his]474-patrick mind were gliding on - But [Delia]201-delia interrupted .

" [North]383-north must go and talk to [[his]474-patrick friends]542-his friends , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said . [North]383-north was glad to go ; but where was [he]383-north to go now ? [He]383-north was [an outsider]4136-an outsider , [he]383-north felt again , as [he]383-north glanced round [the room]577-the room . [All these people]4892-all these people knew [each other]996-each other . [Each]921-each was already part of [a little group]4899-a little group , [he]383-north felt as [he]383-north listened , keeping on the outskirts . [He]383-north wanted to hear what [they]4892-all these people were saying ; but not to be drawn in [himself]383-north . [He]383-north listened . [They]4892-all these people were arguing . Politics and money , [he]383-north said to [himself]383-north ; money and politics . That phrase came in handy . But [he]383-north could not understand the argument , which was already heated . Never have [I]0-i felt so lonely , [he]383-north thought . The old platitude about solitude in [a crowd]2614-a crowd was true ; for [hills and trees]4901-hills and trees accept one ; [human beings]4835-human beings reject one . [He]383-north turned [his]383-north back and pretended to read the particulars of [a desirable property at [Bexhill]186-bexhill]4903-a desirable property at bexhill which [Patrick]474-patrick had called for some reason " a manifesto . "[4905-their] At [their]4905-their age , [he]383-north thought , [he]383-north had been in [the trenches]4910-the trenches ; [he]383-north had seen [men]1412-men killed . [He]383-north turned . [People]503-people met , [he]383-north thought , pretending to read , in [hired halls]4928-hired halls . And one of [them]503-people stood on [a platform]4929-a platform . Liberty ! [He]383-north turned on [his]383-north heel and ran straight into [an old man in a white waistcoat]4934-an old man in a white waistcoat .

" Hullo ! "[383-north] [he]383-north said , holding out [his]383-north hand .

It was [[his]383-north Uncle]4643-his uncle [Edward]215-edward . [He]215-edward had the look of an insect whose body has been eaten out , leaving only the wings , the shell .

" [He]383-north wants to go to college , does [he]383-north ? "[215-edward] [Edward]215-edward went on . " What examinations has [he]383-north passed , eh ? "[215-edward]

And what was [I]0-i thinking ? [North]383-north asked [himself]383-north . [He]383-north felt that [he]383-north had been in [the middle of [a jungle]1745-a jungle]4991-the middle of a jungle ; in the heart of darkness ; cutting [his]383-north way towards the light ; but provided only with broken sentences , single words , with which to break through the briar - bush of human bodies , human wills and voices , that bent over [him]383-north , binding [him]383-north , blinding [him]383-north . . . . [He]383-north listened .

" Well then , tell [him]383-north to come and see [me]215-edward , "[215-edward] said [Edward]215-edward , briskly .

[He]383-north drew [himself]383-north back . No more speech - making for [me]0-i , [he]383-north thought . [He]383-north had [his]383-north glass in [his]383-north hand still . It was still half full of pale yellow liquid . The bubbles had ceased to rise . The wine was clear and still . Stillness and solitude , [he]383-north thought to [himself]383-north ; silence and solitude . . . that 's the only element in which the mind is free now .

Silence and solitude , [he]383-north repeated ; silence and solitude . [His]383-north eyes half closed themselves . [He]383-north was tired ; [he]383-north was dazed ; [people]503-people talked ; [people]503-people talked . [He]383-north would detach [himself]383-north , generalise [himself]383-north , imagine that [he]383-north was lying in a great space on [a blue plain with [hills on the rim of the horizon]5060-hills on the rim of the horizon]5059-a blue plain with hills on the rim of the horizon . [He]383-north made no sense of what [they]5061-they were saying . Through [his]383-north half - open eyes [he]383-north saw hands holding flowers - thin hands , fine hands ; but hands that belonged to [no one]5351-no one . And were [they]5063-they flowers the hands held ? Or [mountains]2112-mountains ? [Blue mountains with violet shadows]5065-blue mountains with violet shadows ? Then petals fell . Pink , yellow , white with violet shadows , the petals fell . They fall and fall and cover all , [he]383-north murmured . And there was the stem of a wine - glass ; the rim of a plate ; and a bowl of water . The hands went on picking up flower after flower ; that was a white rose ; that was a yellow rose ; that was a rose with violet valleys in its petals . There they hung , many folded , many coloured , drooping over the rim of the bowl . And petals fell . There [they]5063-they lay , violet and yellow , little shallops , boats on [a river]6035-a river . And [he]383-north was floating , and drifting , in a shallop , in a petal , down [a river]6035-a river into silence , into solitude . . . which is the worst torture , the words came back to [him]383-north as if a voice had spoken them , that [human beings]4835-human beings can inflict . . . .

[Their]5071-us laughter ceased . Feet thudded , dancing on the floor above . A siren hooted on [the river]813-the river . [A van]1826-a van crashed down [the street]587-the street in the distance . There was a rush and quiver of sound ; something seemed to be released ; it was as if the life of the day were about to begin , and this were the chorus , the cry , the chirp , the stir , which salutes the [London]1-london dawn .

[North]383-north 's head - [he]237-morris was sitting on the floor at [her]276-eleanor feet - was rimmed with whiteness . [His]383-north shirt - front was a little crumpled .

[He]383-north was sitting on the floor at [Edward]215-edward 's feet with [his]383-north hands bound round [his]383-north knees , and [he]383-north gave little jerks and looked up at [him]215-edward as if [he]383-north appealed to [him]215-edward about something .

" [Uncle Edward]215-edward , "[383-north] [she]276-eleanor heard [him]383-north say , " tell [me]383-north this . . . "[383-north]

" [[My]215-edward dear boy]6179-my dear boy , "[215-edward] [she]276-eleanor heard [Edward]215-edward say as [he]215-edward smiled benignly down at [him]383-north , " do n't ask [me]215-edward . "[215-edward] A burst of laughter drowned [his]215-edward words . [She]276-eleanor could not catch the end of the sentence . What had [he]215-edward said - what had [he]215-edward wished to be ? [She]276-eleanor had lost [his]215-edward words .

There must be another life , [she]276-eleanor thought , sinking back into [her]276-eleanor chair , exasperated . Not in dreams ; but here and now , in [this room]843-this room , with [living people]6225-living people . [She]276-eleanor felt as if [she]276-eleanor were standing on the edge of a precipice with [her]276-eleanor hair blown back ; [she]276-eleanor was about to grasp something that just evaded [her]276-eleanor . There must be another life , here and now , [she]276-eleanor repeated . This is too short , too broken . [We]5091-we know nothing , even about [ourselves]5091-we . [We]5091-we 're only just beginning , [she]276-eleanor thought , to understand , here and there . [She]276-eleanor hollowed [her]276-eleanor hands in [her]276-eleanor lap , just as [Rose]204-rose had hollowed hers round [her]204-rose ears . [She]276-eleanor held [her]276-eleanor hands hollowed ; [she]276-eleanor felt that [she]276-eleanor wanted to enclose the present moment ; to make it stay ; to fill it fuller and fuller , with the past , the present and the future , until it shone , whole , bright , deep with understanding .

" [Edward]215-edward , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor began , trying to attract [his]5092-he attention . But [he]5092-he was not listening to [her]276-eleanor ; [he]5092-he was telling [North]383-north some old college story . It 's useless , [she]276-eleanor thought , opening [her]276-eleanor hands . It must drop . It must fall . And then ? [she]276-eleanor thought . For [her]276-eleanor too there would be the endless night ; the endless dark . [She]276-eleanor looked ahead of [her]276-eleanor as though [she]276-eleanor saw opening in front of [her]276-eleanor a very long dark tunnel . But , thinking of the dark , something baffled [her]276-eleanor ; in fact it was growing light . The blinds were white .

There was a stir in [the room]577-the room .

[Edward]215-edward turned to [her]276-eleanor .

" Who are [THEY]1245-two children ? "[5092-he] [he]5092-he asked [her]276-eleanor , pointing to the door .

[She]276-eleanor looked . [Two children]1245-two children stood in the door . [Delia]201-delia had [her]201-delia hands on [their]1245-two children shoulders as if to encourage [them]1245-two children . [She]201-delia was leading [them]1245-two children over to the table in order to give [them]1245-two children something to eat . [They]1245-two children looked awkward and clumsy .

[Eleanor]276-eleanor glanced at [their]1245-two children hands , at [their]1245-two children clothes , at the shape of [their]1245-two children ears . " [The children of [the caretaker]2238-the caretaker]6405-the children of the caretaker , [I]201-delia should think , "[201-delia] [she]201-delia said . Yes , [Delia]201-delia was cutting slices of cake for [them]1245-two children , and they were larger slices of cake than [she]201-delia would have cut had [they]1245-two children been [the children of [[her]201-delia own friends]5096-her own friends]5095-the children of her own friends . [The children]555-the children took the slices and stared at [them]1245-two children with a curious fixed stare as if [they]1245-two children were fierce . But perhaps [they]555-the children were frightened , because [she]201-delia had brought [them]1245-two children up from [the basement]521-the basement into [the drawing - room]698-the drawing - room .

" Eat it ! "[201-delia] said [Delia]201-delia , giving [them]1245-two children a little pat .

[They]555-the children began to munch slowly , gazing solemnly round [them]1245-two children .

" Hullo , [children]569-children ! "[205-martin] cried [Martin]205-martin , beckoning to [them]555-the children . [They]555-the children stared at [him]205-martin solemnly .

" Have n't [you]555-the children got a name ? "[205-martin] [he]205-martin said . [They]555-the children went on eating in silence . [He]205-martin began to fumble in [his]205-martin pocket .

" Speak ! "[205-martin] [he]205-martin said . " Speak ! "[205-martin]

" [The younger generation]4485-the younger generation , "[316-maggie] said [Peggy]316-maggie , " do n't mean to speak . "[316-maggie]

[They]555-the children turned [their]555-the children eyes on [her]316-maggie now ; but [they]555-the children went on munching . " [No school]6409-no school tomorrow ? "[316-maggie] [she]316-maggie said . [They]555-the children shook [their]555-the children heads from side to side .

" Hurrah ! "[205-martin] said [Martin]205-martin . [He]205-martin held the coins in [his]205-martin hand ; pressed between [his]205-martin thumb and finger . " Now - sing a song for sixpence ! "[205-martin] [he]205-martin said .

" Yes . Were n't [you]555-the children taught something at [school]867-school ? "[316-maggie] [Peggy]316-maggie asked .

[They]555-the children stared at [her]316-maggie but remained silent . [They]555-the children had stopped eating . [They]555-the children were a centre of [a little group]4899-a little group . [They]555-the children swept [their]555-the children eyes over [the grown - up people]5101-the grown - up people for a moment , then , each giving [the other]922-the other a little nudge , [they]555-the children burst into song :

Etho passo tanno hai , Fai donk to tu do , [Mai]494-mai to , kai to , lai to see Toh dom to tuh do -

That was what it sounded like . Not a word was recognisable . The distorted sounds rose and sank as if [they]555-the children followed a tune . [They]555-the children stopped .

[They]555-the children stood with [their]555-the children hands behind [their]555-the children backs . Then with one impulse [they]555-the children attacked the next verse :

Fanno to par , etto to mar , [Timin tudo]495-timin tudo , tido , Foll to gar in , mitno to par , [Eido]496-eido , teido , meido -

[They]555-the children sang the second verse more fiercely than the first . The rhythm seemed to rock and the unintelligible words ran themselves together almost into a shriek . [The grown - up people]5101-the grown - up people did not know whether to laugh or to cry . [Their]5101-the grown - up people voices were so harsh ; the accent was so hideous .

[They]555-the children burst out again :

[Chree]497-chree to gay ei , [Geeray]498-geeray didax . . . .

Then [they]555-the children stopped . It seemed to be in the middle of a verse . [They]555-the children stood there grinning , silent , looking at the floor . [Nobody]575-nobody knew what to say . There was something horrible in the noise [they]555-the children made . It was so shrill , so discordant , and so meaningless . Then [old Patrick]474-patrick ambled up .

" Ah , that 's very nice , that 's very nice . Thank [you]555-the children , [[my]474-patrick dears]6411-my dears , "[474-patrick] [he]474-patrick said in [his]474-patrick genial way , fiddling with [his]474-patrick toothpick . [The children]555-the children grinned at [him]474-patrick . Then [they]555-the children began to make off . As [they]555-the children sidled past [Martin]205-martin , [he]474-patrick slipped coins into [their]555-the children hands . Then [they]555-the children made a dash for the door .

" But what the devil were [they]555-the children singing ? "[255-gibbs] said [Hugh Gibbs]255-gibbs . " [I]255-gibbs could n't understand a word of it , [I]255-gibbs must confess . "[255-gibbs] [He]255-gibbs held [his]255-gibbs hands to the sides of [his]255-gibbs large white waistcoat .

" Cockney accent , [I]474-patrick suppose , "[474-patrick] said [Patrick]474-patrick . " What [they]555-the children teach 'em at [school]867-school , [you]276-eleanor know . "[474-patrick]

" But it was . . . "[276-eleanor] [Eleanor]276-eleanor began . [She]276-eleanor stopped . What was it ? As [they]555-the children stood there [they]555-the children had looked so dignified ; yet [they]555-the children had made this hideous noise . The contrast between [their]555-the children faces and [their]555-the children voices was astonishing ; it was impossible to find one word for the whole . " Beautiful ? "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , with a note of interrogation , turning to [Maggie]316-maggie .

" Extraordinarily , "[316-maggie] said [Maggie]316-maggie .

But [Eleanor]276-eleanor was not sure that [they]555-the children were thinking of the same thing .

[She]276-eleanor gathered together [her]276-eleanor gloves , [her]276-eleanor bag and two or three coppers , and got up . [The room]577-the room was full of a queer pale light . [Objects]499-objects seemed to be rising out of [their]499-objects sleep , out of [their]499-objects disguise , and to be assuming the sobriety of daily life . [The room]577-the room was making ready for [its]577-the room use as [[an estate agent]5108-an estate agent 's office]5109-an estate agent 's office . The tables were becoming office tables ; [their]555-the children legs were the legs of [office tables]5110-office tables , and yet they were still strewn with plates and glasses , with roses , lilies and carnations .

" It 's time to go , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said , crossing [the room]577-the room . [Delia]201-delia had gone to the window . Now [she]201-delia jerked the curtains open .

" The dawn ! "[201-delia] [she]201-delia exclaimed rather melodramatically .

The shapes of [houses]1311-houses appeared across [the square]1857-the square . [Their]1311-houses blinds were all drawn ; [they]1311-houses seemed fast asleep still in the morning pallor .

" The dawn ! "[431-nicholas] said [Nicholas]431-nicholas , getting up and stretching [himself]431-nicholas . [He]431-nicholas too walked across to the window . [Renny]389-renny followed [him]431-nicholas .

" But the dawn has risen , "[389-renny] said [Renny]389-renny , pointing at the sky .

It was a fact . The sun had risen . The sky between the chimneys looked extraordinarily blue .

" And [I]431-nicholas am going to bed , "[431-nicholas] said [Nicholas]431-nicholas after a pause . [He]431-nicholas turned away .

" Where is [Sara]344-sara ? "[431-nicholas] [he]431-nicholas said , looking round [him]431-nicholas . There [she]5114-she was curled up in a corner with [her]5114-she head against a table asleep apparently .

" [Nicholas]431-nicholas ! "[5114-she] [she]5114-she exclaimed .

" [Sara]344-sara ! "[431-nicholas] [he]431-nicholas replied . [They]5115-they smiled at [each other]996-each other . Then [he]431-nicholas helped [her]5114-she up and [she]5114-she balanced [herself]5114-she uncertainly against [[her]5114-she sister]615-her sister , and rubbed [her]5114-she eyes .

There were the smeared plates , and the empty wine - glasses ; the petals and the bread crumbs . In the mixture of lights [they]5115-they looked prosaic but unreal ; cadaverous but brilliant . And there against the window , gathered in [a group]3582-a group , were [the old brothers]5119-the old brothers and [sisters]5120-sisters .

[The group in the window]5122-the group in the window , [the men in [their]5123-the men in their black - and - white evening dress black - and - white evening dress]5123-the men in their black - and - white evening dress , the women in [their]5124-they crimsons , golds and silvers , wore a statuesque air for a moment , as if [they]5124-they were carved in stone . " Ca n't [I]254-kitty give [you]615-her sister a lift back , [Nell]276-eleanor ? "[254-kitty] [Kitty Lasswade]254-kitty was saying . " [I]254-kitty 've [a car]2494-a car waiting . "[254-kitty]

The windows were spotted with gold . Everything looked clean swept , fresh and virginal . The pigeons were shuffling on the tree tops .

" [I]254-kitty 've [a car]2494-a car . . . "[254-kitty] [Kitty]254-kitty repeated .

" There on [the tree tops]3961-the tree tops , "[254-kitty] said [Kitty]254-kitty . The green - blue birds were shuffling about on the branches , pecking and crooning to [themselves]5124-they .

[Morris]237-morris brushed the crumbs off [his]237-morris waistcoat .

" What an hour for [us]6418-we old fogies to be out of bed ! "[237-morris] [he]237-morris said . " [I]237-morris have n't seen the sun rise since . . . since . . . . "[237-morris]

" Ah , but when [we]6418-we were young , "[474-patrick] said [old Patrick]474-patrick , slapping [him]474-patrick on the shoulder , " [we]6418-we thought nothing of making a night of it ! [Delia]201-delia smiled as if some romance , [her]201-delia own or another 's , had been recalled to [her]201-delia .

" And [I]276-eleanor . . . "[276-eleanor] [Eleanor]276-eleanor began . [She]276-eleanor stopped . [She]276-eleanor saw an empty milk jug and leaves falling . Then it had been autumn . Now it was summer . The sky was a faint blue ; the roofs were tinged purple against the blue ; the chimneys were a pure brick red . An air of ethereal calm and simplicity lay over everything .

" And all the tubes have stopped , and all the omnibuses , "[276-eleanor] [she]276-eleanor said turning round . " How are [we]5130-you going to get [home]608-home ? "[276-eleanor]

" Not on a fine summer morning , "[205-martin] said [Martin]205-martin .

A breeze went through [the square]1857-the square . In the stillness [they]5130-you could hear the branches rustle as they rose slightly , and fell , and shook a wave of green light through the air .

Then the door burst open . [Couple]5131-couple after [couple]5131-couple came flocking in , dishevelled , gay , to look for [their]5131-couple cloaks and [their]5131-couple hats , to say good - night .

The sun had risen , and the sky above [the houses]1569-the houses wore an air of extraordinary beauty , simplicity and peace .

[THE END]189-the end
